Jump to: How it works | History & Tech | Design | App | FAQs | Team 

Frequently Asked Questions

Healbe FLOW Technology FAQs

Q: How was Healbe FLOW™ Technology developed?

A: In 1999, a St. Petersburg-based company called Algorithm set out to develop a model of how glucose is used within the body, with the hopes of developing a device that could monitor glucose levels non-invasively. Algorithm applied the methodology of TRIZ, which is a Theory of Inventive Problem Solving that brings together multiple disciplines to focus on a common problem.

The initial working group included an endocrinologist, a physician, a mathematician, and a TRIZ analyst. At later stages of the project, the team expanded to include clinical diagnosticians, engineers, and programmers. Development of the basic technology was completed by 2003, including more than 500 internal tests.

In 2012, Healbe™ acquired Algorithm’s technology and set out to adapt it to automatically monitor calorie intake and burn. We developed a stream of mathematical models that allowed us to apply the basic technology to a range of physiological processes. The final result is Healbe FLOW™ Technology.

Currently, Healbe™ has five separate research groups, each working on perfecting a specific solution within the overall technology: Automatic calorie intake and hydration; calorie burn; continuous heart rate monitoring; sleep; and stress.

Healbe GoBe™ is the first product to leverage FLOW Technology.

Q: How does Healbe FLOW™ Technology automatically measure calorie intake?

A: FLOW Technology uses an algorithm to analyze data from the Healbe GoBe™ 100% Automatic Body Manager’s three sensors. To calculate calorie intake, FLOW uses readings from an impedance sensor, taken four times per minute, to measure the body’s “glucose curve” throughout the day.

After you eat, insulin triggers your cells to absorb glucose and release water. The Body Manager’s impedance sensor measures these changes by sending high and low frequency signals through your tissue to determine the fluid volume of your cells. FLOW uses this information about your cells’ changing glucose concentrations to calculate calorie intake.

Q: What is the glucose curve?

A: After you eat, carbohydrates from your meal are converted into glucose in the blood. Insulin triggers your cells to absorb glucose, which is used for energy. In the process, glucose displaces liquids in your cells, and the Body Manager’s impedance sensor measures these changes in cellular structure by sending high- and low-frequency signals through your tissue to determine the volume of the liquids.

FLOW evaluates how quickly glucose is absorbed into your cells, and how long cellular glucose levels stay elevated, to calculate the glucose curve. Fat in your meal changes the speed of absorption of glucose, and hence the shape of the glucose curve.

Q: Does Healbe GoBe™ measure blood glucose levels?

A: No, GoBe doesn’t directly measure the amount of glucose in the blood. It uses an impedance sensor to measure the flow of liquids in and out of the cells, and uses that data to calculate how glucose is being absorbed into cells in the body’s tissues.

Q: Can a person with diabetes use GoBe to automatically measure their calorie intake?

A: GoBe is not designed to measure glucose in the treatment of diabetes, and it is not a substitute for regular glucose monitoring. However, a diabetic who uses insulin properly to control his or her blood glucose levels would be able to use GoBe to automatically measure calorie intake.

Q: Does FLOW Technology measure the amount of fats and carbs consumed?

A: Yes. FLOW Technology measures how many fats and carbs you consume, and the Body Manager’s App provides insights into the macronutrient breakdown of your food. When you eat, carbohydrates and fats from your meal are converted to energy, using two separate physiological mechanisms.

The relative proportions of fat and carbohydrates in your meal effect the shape of the glucose curve. Generally speaking, carbohydrate-heavy meals cause rapid uptake of glucose by your cells. Meals containing more fat lead to a slower absorption of glucose. FLOW uses a sophisticated mathematical model to analyze the dynamics of your glucose curve and determine the percentage of calories you consume from carbohydrates vs. fats.

Q: How accurate is GoBe’s automatic calorie intake measurement, and how has it been tested?

A: Healbe™ has conducted multiple tests to determine how accurate GoBe is at measuring calorie intake. During the tests, subjects wore GoBe while eating precisely measured meals, and we compared GoBe’s readings with the known calorie content of the food consumed. Currently, the margin of error for calorie intake measurement is 15-20% compared to calorie counts on food labels. This level of accuracy compares very favorably to the estimation and guesswork of manual calorie tracking—and it’s groundbreaking in terms of measuring calorie intake with no user input. 

Q: How accurate is GoBe’s calorie intake measurement compared to wearable devices and apps that require users to manually log what they eat and drink?

A: Trying to track your calorie intake manually can be very inaccurate for several reasons. First, there’s user error. Unless you precisely weigh or measure every bite you eat (including ingredients in prepared meals), you have to rely on estimation. It’s very difficult to correctly estimate the amount of cheese on a particular piece of pizza, or the number of chocolate chips in a cookie.

Second, even if you only eat food that comes in a package that provides a calorie count, the actual calories you end up ingesting will differ based on how the food is prepared. For example, the calories in a serving of pasta could vary from 135-320 calories, depending on how well it’s cooked—so if you’re manually tracking your calories, your accuracy can vary greatly.

Finally, because of individual differences in metabolism, two people eating exactly the same type and amount of food might actually process different amounts of calories from their meals. There’s no way to account for these differences in metabolism using manual calorie tracking.

Q: How will Healbe™ continue to test and improve the accuracy of FLOW Technology’s automatic calorie intake measurement?

A: FLOW Technology’s automatic calorie intake measurement depends on a sophisticated model of the glucose curve—that is, how glucose and water are absorbed and released by your cells in response to calories consumed. Our future efforts will be aimed at increasing the accuracy of our glucose curve model. We are also finalizing a more accurate method of estimating the amount of calories coming from protein in food.

We will continue to conduct internal tests of the product over the next 2 months for the first version of Healbe GoBe™, with external testing planned for May-June.

Q: How accurate is GoBe’s measurement of calories burned, and how has it been tested?

A: GoBe measures calories burned during any activity by combining accelerometer data with continuous heart rate monitoring. We’ve tested the calorie burn measurement by asking subjects to wear GoBe while performing typical exercises such as running or walking. We then compare GoBe’s data with standard calculations based on the subject’s height, weight, and gender—the same type of calculations a treadmill uses to estimate calories burned during a workout. Currently, GoBe’s calorie burn measurement is 90-95% accurate, compared to these standard calculations. We are working on expanding the types of activities GoBe can accurately measure, and on improving the overall accuracy of FLOW Technology’s data.

Q: Does GoBe measure blood oxygen levels?

A: No, GoBe doesn’t measure the oxygen levels in your blood.

Q: How does GoBe track heart rate? How frequent is the measurement taken?

A: GoBe uses a piezo pressure sensor to measure your heart rate several times in a minute.

Q: Does GoBe measure body temperature?

A: No, GoBe doesn’t measure internal body temperature.

Q: Can GoBe measure calorie intake for someone following a ketogenic or low-carb diet?

A: Yes. If you’re following a ketogenic or low-carb diet, you can use GoBe to automatically measure your calorie intake by adjusting a setting in the Healbe™ Body Manager app. However; currently, FLOW Technology provides a more accurate calorie intake measurement for carbohydrates and fats, so if you’re following a low-carb diet you will see a decrease in accuracy. We are working on improving FLOW Technology’s ability to measure calorie intake from protein sources.

GoBe Product FAQs

Q: Is GoBe waterproof?

A: Yes. GoBe is waterproof up to 3 meters. It can be worn in the shower or for a swim.

Q: How long does the battery last?

A: The body manager will operate up to 3 days on a single charge during typical use. The battery can be fully charged in approximately 1 hour.

Q: What color is the band?

A: GoBe is available in black. We anticipate that different colors will be available on the Healbe™ website starting in July.

Q: What physical activities can GoBe track?

A: Healbe GoBeTM combines accelerometer data with continuous heart rate monitoring to calculate calorie burn and metabolic rate during any activity – jogging, swimming, cycling, weight training, and more.

Q: How soon after eating does GoBe calculate your calorie intake?

A: Approximately 15-20 minutes after you eat, glucose concentrations in your blood start to rise. GoBe detects those changes and uses the information to calculate the calories you consumed.

Q: Can GoBe be used as a glucose monitor for someone with diabetes?

A: GoBe is not intended to diagnose or treat any medical condition, and it doesn't replace standard glucose monitoring for diabetics.

Q: Does GoBe track blood pressure?

A: Yes. GoBe uses a piezo pressure sensor to measure pulse wave and blood pressure.

Q: What smartphones does the Body Manager’s app support?

A: The app is compatible with all phones running a BLE-enabled iOS or Android operating system.

Q: If my phone’s operating system doesn’t support the app, will I be able to use all the features with the website?

A: No. A user must have a compatible phone so information can be delivered to the website.

Q: Can I sync my body manager’s data with third party apps?

A: At initial launch, GoBe will be compatible only with the body manager app. In the future, we hope to enable many popular third party apps to analyze GoBe data. 

Jump to: How it works | History & Tech | Design | App | FAQs | Team 

Team

Meet the Healbe™ team—the pioneers behind GoBe and FLOW Technology. We all bring unique expertise—from medicine to product design to rocket science. What unites us? Quite simply, a desire to help people find a better way to manage their diets and take control of their health

"I want to make health and fitness effortless, so people can simply live and better understand their own bodies in every moment."

Artem Shipitsyn, CEO, a major developer of market solutions and new products for global brands such as Rostelecom, Sberbank, L'Oreal, Valio, Reebok, Hearst Shkulev, Discovery Channel and more.

George Mikaberydze, Managing Director, brings 10 years of experience in marketing, management and business development. Innovated new business marketing and strategy for Hearst Shkulev Media and RBC Media Holding, a major holder of magazine, television, and web publishing ventures.

Stanislav Povolotskiy, Head of Sales, has been managing sales teams since 1997, with a track record of exponential sales growth.

Jozeph Forakis, Product Designer, is the creative force behind Motorola V70™ and multiple Swatch® products.

Michael Rubin, Chief Researcher at Algorithm, a subsidiary of GEN3 Partners. Master of TRIZ, a problem-solving and analysis tool developed by the Russian inventor and science fiction author Genrich Altshuller.

Eugene Sokolov, Chief Scientist, applies his background as a rocket scientist to global innovation.

Pavel Mussel, Head of Mobile & Internet Services, has more than a decade of experience in digital production and brand strategy development.

 

Jump to: How it works | History & Tech | Design | App | FAQs | Team 

Why Indiegogo?

We've developed something that will make people's lives happier, healthier, and easier—every day. It only makes sense to invite everyone to get involved, so GoBe can do more, faster. We think the concept behind GoBe and FLOW Technology—effortless health, fitness, and balance—is something everyone can get behind. It takes wearable technology to new places by empowering people to simply wear it and be their best selves.

We've set a goal of $100,000, which will allow us to begin serial manufacturing and make GoBe widely available as soon as June 2014.

Development status and use of funds

We unveiled our working GoBe prototype and fully functional software app to a select group of retailers at CES 2014 as part of Levin Consulting's meeting place, located at South Hall 25168. Every dollar raised through Indiegogo will go directly to software improvement and manufacturing of GoBe devices.

Future Plans

We are continuing to develop and refine our technology for a wide range of applications.

Apart from regular patent research, we are conducting studies in order to forecast the future of human health monitoring systems. Currently we have both short-term and long-term (to 2030) plans for the development of FLOW Technology.

Continued development of our technology will focus on improving the accuracy and reliability of measurement, and improving the accuracy of our models for evaluating human health parameters. Our research activities are divided into three types:

Study and development of long-term concepts

Research on improving the operational value of our most promising technologies

We are also extending the list of parameters monitored and how we use these sets of parameters, and we plan to develop products for groups such as athletes, children, and seniors. Next year, we expect to introduce fundamental changes to the wristband’s design.

We like this work. We want to surprise the world. Dreams should come true. The most mysterious and interesting thing in the world is related to ourselves, our life. People still know little about the human body. We are sure that with your support, and the help of those who have been involved in the Healbe™ project, we can solve many mysteries of the human body and human health. 

Media

We love talking about GoBe! 

Contact gobe@healbe.com to request press information.

Delivery Timeline & Refund Requests

Healbe™ is working diligently to ensure that all GoBe perks are delivered to Indiegogo contributors on time. That being said, delivery of rewards are subject to best efforts and are not guaranteed. 

While Indiegogo terms of use state that all contributions are non-refundable, Healbe™ is committed to ensuring the satisfaction of those who have supported our GoBe campaign.

To request a refund please forward your contribution confirmation to gobe@healbe.com and indicate why and how you would like to receive your refund. We can either issue you a refund via PayPal immediately or via check once the campaign has concluded. Make sure to provide your PayPal account or mailing address when requesting a refund. It should be noted that we cannot transfer funds back to your credit card directly, because we do not have access to card information and only receive a total contribution amount from Indiegogo upon the conclusion of the campaign.

We will honor refund requests through the end of the campaign.
story_txt:
The Original 100% Automatic Body Manager™
GoBe is the only way to automatically measure calorie intake—through your skin. Simply wear it to see calories consumed and burned, activity, hydration, sleep, stress levels, and more, delivered effortlessly to your smartphone.
Everything else is just a manual calorie tracker. Only GoBe precisely calculates calorie intake, burn, and metabolic rate during any activity, with no logging, tracking, or guesswork.
Jump to: How it works | History & Tech | Design | App | FAQs | Team 

GoBe doesn't require you to keep a food diary, scan bar codes, or take photos of your meals. It automatically measures calories consumed through your skin. Only GoBe uses Healbe FLOW™ Technology to combine a unique algorithm with measurements from the body manager's pressure, accelerometer, and impedance sensors to show you calories consumed; metabolic rate and calories burned during any activity; hydration; sleep; and stress.

How does Healbe GoBe™ work?

Jump to: How it works | History & Tech | Design | App | FAQs | Team 

History & Technology
Dr. Vladimir
Leonidovich Emmanuel Provides His Expert Opinion on the Technology Behind GoBe
and FLOW. 
Throughout the development of GoBe, Healbe™
consulted closely with Vladimir Leonidovich Emmanuel, M.D., chief of the
Central Clinical Pathology Laboratory and Medical Laboratory Diagnostics
Department within the Molecular Medicine Department at Saint Petersburg Pavlov
State Medical University. Dr. Emmanuel is a medical doctor and professor. He is
also the vice president of the Russian Medical Laboratory Diagnostics
Association; a chief expert in clinical pathology with the Federal Service for
Healthcare Administration for the Northwestern Federal District; and a member
of the Metrological Academy. 
Regarding GoBe’s method of automatically
measuring calorie intake*, Dr. Emmanuel concluded:


The concept of the suggested
device is coherent with contemporary ideas about the physiological processes
taking place in the human organism in the course of energy accumulation and
consumption.

The presented description of hardware and software shows that it is the
only system capable of such long-lasting monitoring of glucose concentration in
blood.
The presented version of the
hardware and software system is coherent with contemporary ideas about
physiological processes taking place in the human organism in the course of
carbohydrate accumulation after a meal.
The accuracy rate of glucose
concentration calculating methods that this hardware and software system’s
computing model is based on (15-20%) are quite enough, in my point of view, for
implementation of a device intended for day-to-day applications.

Click here for more information on the
testing and validation of the technology behind GoBe and Flow.

Healbe™ Partners
MicroArts Creative
Agency
“Over the past 25 years, MicroArts has facilitated the
launch of more than 300 brands. We have been honored to work with some of the
largest and most reputable companies in the world. We are proud to be a part of
the Healbe™ team and the launch of both GoBe and FLOW Technology – innovations
that we feel are truly game changing in the wearable fitness category. Having
worked closely with Artem and his team, I am confident GoBe has a very bright
future.”
- Brian Blanchette, President of Microarts Creative Agency.
Levin Consulting
“Since 1988, Levin Consulting has specialized in helping
consumer electronics developers build sales strategies and distribution
networks that ensure innovative products get into the hands of consumers. We
are excited to be working with Healbe™ on the GoBe 100% Automatic Body Manager,
which marks the next evolution of wearable health technology.”
- Bob Marcantonio, President of Levin Consulting
The Patented
Technology Behind GoBe
We’ve received several patents for the technology and
hardware behind GoBe. 

On November 22, 2013, Healbe™
received a favorable decision granting the company a patent for its invention,
“A Method of Human Blood Glucose Concentration Measurement” (patent application
№ RU2012106461).
On February 12, 2014, Healbe™
received a patent for its invention, “Sensor for Measuring Impedance of a Human
Body Area” (patent application № RU2012155821).
On March 12, 2014, Healbe™
was granted the patent for an invention, “Method for Measuring Human Organism’s
Calorie Intake during a Meal” (patent application № RU2012155819).

data. 

Jump to: How it works | History & Tech | Design | App | FAQs | Team 

Team
Meet the Healbe™ team—the pioneers behind GoBe and FLOW Technology. We all bring unique expertise—from medicine to product design to rocket science. What unites us? Quite simply, a desire to help people find a better way to manage their diets and take control of their health
"I want to make health and fitness effortless, so people can simply live and better understand their own bodies in every moment."
Artem Shipitsyn, CEO, a major developer of market solutions and new products for global brands such as Rostelecom, Sberbank, L'Oreal, Valio, Reebok, Hearst Shkulev, Discovery Channel and more.
George Mikaberydze, Managing Director, brings 10 years of experience in marketing, management and business development. Innovated new business marketing and strategy for Hearst Shkulev Media and RBC Media Holding, a major holder of magazine, television, and web publishing ventures.
Stanislav Povolotskiy, Head of Sales, has been managing sales teams since 1997, with a track record of exponential sales growth.
Jozeph Forakis, Product Designer, is the creative force behind Motorola V70™ and multiple Swatch® products.
Michael Rubin, Chief Researcher at Algorithm, a subsidiary of GEN3 Partners. Master of TRIZ, a problem-solving and analysis tool developed by the Russian inventor and science fiction author Genrich Altshuller.
Eugene Sokolov, Chief Scientist, applies his background as a rocket scientist to global innovation.
Pavel Mussel, Head of Mobile & Internet Services, has more than a decade of experience in digital production and brand strategy development.

 
Jump to: How it works | History & Tech | Design | App | FAQs | Team 
Why Indiegogo?
We've developed something that will make people's lives happier, healthier, and easier—every day. It only makes sense to invite everyone to get involved, so GoBe can do more, faster. We think the concept behind GoBe and FLOW Technology—effortless health, fitness, and balance—is something everyone can get behind. It takes wearable technology to new places by empowering people to simply wear it and be their best selves.
We've set a goal of $100,000, which will allow us to begin serial manufacturing and make GoBe widely available as soon as June 2014.
Development status and use of funds

We unveiled our working GoBe prototype and fully functional software app to a select group of retailers at CES 2014 as part of Levin Consulting's meeting place, located at South Hall 25168. Every dollar raised through Indiegogo will go directly to software improvement and manufacturing of GoBe devices.Future Plans
We are continuing to develop and refine our
technology for a wide range of applications. 
Apart from regular patent research, we are
conducting studies in order to forecast the future of human health monitoring
systems. Currently we have both short-term and long-term (to 2030) plans for
the development of FLOW Technology. 
Continued development of our technology will focus on
improving the accuracy and reliability of measurement, and improving the
accuracy of our models for evaluating human health parameters. Our research
activities are divided into three types:Study
and development of long-term concepts
Research
on improving the operational value of our most promising technologies
We are also extending the list of parameters
monitored and how we use these sets of parameters, and we plan to develop
products for groups such as athletes, children, and seniors. Next year,
we expect to introduce fundamental changes to the wristband’s design. 
We like this work. We want to surprise the world.
Dreams should come true. The most mysterious and interesting thing in the world
is related to ourselves, our life. People still know little about the human
body. We are
sure that with your support, and the help of those who have been involved in
the Healbe™ project, we can solve many mysteries of the human body and human
health. 
Media
We love talking about GoBe! 
Contact gobe@healbe.com to request press information.
Delivery Timeline & Refund RequestsHealbe™ is working diligently to ensure that all GoBe perks are delivered to Indiegogo contributors on time. That being said, delivery of rewards are subject to best efforts and are not guaranteed. 

While Indiegogo terms of use state that all contributions are non-refundable, Healbe™ is committed to ensuring the satisfaction of those who have supported our GoBe campaign.
To request a refund please forward your contribution confirmation to gobe@healbe.com and indicate why and how you would like to receive your refund. We can either issue you a refund via PayPal immediately or via check once the campaign has concluded. Make sure to provide your PayPal account or mailing address when requesting a refund. It should be noted that we cannot transfer funds back to your credit card directly, because we do not have access to card information and only receive a total contribution amount from Indiegogo upon the conclusion of the campaign.We will honor refund requests through the end of the campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
On the early months of 2012 our son Matthew complained from double vision a couple times within a couple of weeks, later on he started with morning vomiting almost every day, after seeing different doctors we visited a neurologist who discarded the possibility of something serious but suggest to make an MRI to be on the safe side.

The MRI was scheduled for April 2012. The results from the MRI were devastating for us, as the doctors indicated they have found something. The following day we met with the neurosurgeon who to read the MRI images for us, brain tumor on the fourth ventricle he said, the words still echo inside my head, don't remember much more from that day.

After researching for a couple of weeks for the best possibility for him, he was schedule to undergo surgery to remove the tumor. After days of preparations, the day came when we needed to walk the long hallway to the surgery ward, to kiss him and to tell him we will be waiting right there for him.

The surgery was successful but it took a day or two to see him trying to say a word, the long road to recovery was just starting, then the bad news kept coming, after a few days the final results from the histology came, medulloblastoma grade IV WHO.

That was the day we understood for first time our son was starting a long battle against an aggressive type of brain cancer. We were discharged from the hospital after a week and went back after 8 days only to have the stitches removed.

From there on we were again on our own, what to do, who to look for, was most found by internet. We started communication with the kinder clinic of the university hospital in Heidelberg, Germany. In the mean time, Matthew started his physical rehabilitation with a private physiotherapist.

All our efforts pay back when we understood we have date for consultation. The government fund has agreed to pay for his treatment abroad as Bulgaria dont have the tecnology to treat such cancer. We travel on July 8th. to Germany as the appointment was schedule for the 9th.

 

After several days, MRIs, spinal tap and many other tests, we were told about the treatment plan they have made for him, 30 Radiation sessions, 17 to his head and 13 to his spine.

We needed to agree to implant a hickman to receive medication, take blood etc. Radiation finally started on August 2nd. it was hard to see him going half day without food or water as he was put to sleep every day from Monday to Friday in order to receive his daily dose. Matthew ended exhausted, feeling tired most times and without much enthusiasm for anything.

We have two weeks break that we use to come back to Bulgaria and see family and close friends. We will be travelling back within a week to start his one year long chemotherapy treatment and our possibilities start to be limited, being away from home, spending entire days in hospitals leaves us on a bad financial situation, the money raised will help us go through this year without much worries so we can focus more time on our son treatment.

It is hard to find a way to pay back to all of you who has the possibility to help us, but we can promise you that nothing will go unnoticed and we hope that someday we will be in the position to help another child in need.

story:
Alexia is 8 years old with Glomerulonephritis, MPGN type 1

  • My name is Kristin Johnson and I am Alexia's auntie. She is an amazing little girl and it's been hard for our family to watch her go through this especially at such a young age. 
  • I hope to try and speed up the process of the surgery so that Alexia can get back to being a kid again, rather than her entire life revolving around the hospital. 
  • Alexia is in the final stages of kidney failure and needs a transplant as soon as possible. For the past few month she has been going to dialysis 3 times a week for 4 hours. Fortunately, I am a match to donate the needed kidney to my niece.
  • Alexia will have a surgery within the next month to remove both kidneys to prepare her body for the transplant.
  • My sister is a single mother with no support from Alexia's father, Our parents have helped beyond belief, doing all they can for their grandchild Alexia.
  • Financially, in order to start this process our family is required to show we have a excess of $3000-$5000 available before the surgery will even be scheduled. The family is grateful for any amount we are able to raise. No matter what every little bit will help Alexia and her recovery.

Alexia's dream is to one day become a nurse so that she can help children like herself better deal with the health issues they face. 

Be sure to visit and 'Like' her Facebook page at the link below. She loves reading the comments on a daily basis, and while she is in dialysis.

My name is Kristin Johnson and I am Alexia's auntie. She is an amazing little girl and it's been hard for our family to watch her go through this especially at such a young age. 
I hope to try and speed up the process of the surgery so that Alexia can get back to being a kid again, rather than her entire life revolving around the hospital.  Alexia is in the final stages of kidney failure and needs a transplant as soon as possible. For the past few month she has been going to dialysis 3 times a week for 4 hours. Fortunately, I am a match to donate the needed kidney to my niece.
Alexia will have a surgery within the next month to remove both kidneys to prepare her body for the transplant.
My sister is a single mother with no support from Alexia's father, Our parents have helped beyond belief, doing all they can for their grandchild Alexia.
Financially, in order to start this process our family is required to show we have a excess of $3000-$5000 available before the surgery will even be scheduled. The family is grateful for any amount we are able to raise. No matter what every little bit will help Alexia and her recovery.
Alexia's dream is to one day become a nurse so that she can help children like herself better deal with the health issues they face. Be sure to visit and 'Like' her Facebook page at the link below. She loves reading the comments on a daily basis, and while she is in dialysis.

story:
Water in the Aida Refugee Camp in Bethlehem is scarce and of questionable quality. Due to the intermittent supply, water is often stored outdoors in large plastic containers for long periods of time, which increases the likelihood of contamination and associated health problems. 

Six students from the Tufts University Water: Systems, Science, and Society (WSSS) graduate certificate program will be working with a local community-based organization, Lajee Center, to provide tools to improve water quality and provide community-wide education and training.

Your support will help provide clean water to the residents of Aida Camp. All proceeds will go directly to continued water testing, educational materials and programs, and resources to improve water quality.


Here are a few ways your donations help.

$25 provides funding for water testing at 20 households.

$150 buys a new water storage tank for an entire family.

**All donations are tax deductible**


For more information

Water Quality in Aida Refugee Camp - 2012 Report

This report documents the 2012 WSSS Practicum Project, which established the current water quality testing program in Aida Camp. 

Lajee Center - www.lajee.org

This is a community-based cultural center in Aida Camp. 


Tufts 2014 WSSS Palestine members

Megan Faletra, Tanuja Kulkarni, Margaret McKenzie, Jennifer Olsen, Thomas Pols, Terrence Smith                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          

(Video credit: Ayah Badran, Amahl Bishara, Jen Bogle, Nelly Czajkowski, John Durant, Maggie Holmesheoran, Annette Huber-Lee, Amy Hunter, Meg Keegan, Rusty Russell, and Matt Simon.)

story:
Operation Enduring Fitness comprises a detachment of 26 men and women deploying with the American Armed Forces. Physically fit and able bodied, our current status restricts our access to quality fitness gear. With your contributions, we propose to purchase gym equipment from the American company Rogue Fitness. Rogue Fitness is American-Owned and American-made.

Our personal fitness is important to us as a fighting unit and helps us to deal with the stress of deployment; being away from friends, family, and home.

Our goal is $2,500.00. Any and all help towards reaching this goal is appreciated, and we thank you for taking your time to show your support.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, My name is Mukim 50 Years old Housewife living in United Kingdom. I'm a Indian born and have lived in and seen poverty. It's very hard for us to understand how they feel when they can't find any help from government or Charities but when somebody like us step forward and contribute and help suddenly they feel like they have someone looking over them. 

This campaign is will help real people and this is a 100% non-Profit making help. I cannot do this alone and i need people with big hearts to help them with me who understand how it feels to help one another. We could have been in their shoes but luckily we aren't. 

Hopefully slowly but surely we will expand and will see smile on their face. 


What We Need & What You Get

I am looking for £2500 ($3888), with that i will make sure this Disable Child gets his Hands & Feets looked after and his Hospital treatments. Also need a water pump in a Village so they can drink clean water and use it for other utilities.

£1500 will be spent on this child including his Food, Medicines, Hospital cost, Wheelchair, Cloths & some for his Alone mother.

£1000 for Hand Pump in a Village where it will be used daily. 

If there is somebody who would like to donate for Hand Pump Alone will put your name engraved on metal plate on Hand pump for life and people will remember you forever.

The Impact

I hope after we reach amount we need i will make sure  all of you are satisfied with  your donation and will keep you up-to-date with latest information on how we are doing to make changes in their life.

Risks & Challenges

It's not easy for all of us to contribute and save this large amount, neither it's easy for them daily when they wake up and think about what they are going to eat today and how they are going to find help, trust me once i reach this amount this will bring biggest change in their life.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help please try to get the word out and let others around you who can even donate a £1 that will help alot too.

£1 = 1 day food for 2

Please SHARE and HELP

story:
Short Summary

Founded in May 2011, Modern Health Fitness (MHF) is a fitness and wellness company that became operational in October 2011. The vision for MHF is to create a alternative healthcare solution that empowers individuals to take control over their health, rather than placing it in the hands of hospitals and insurance agencies. We hold firm on our stance that no reasonable explanation can confirm why the incidence and prevalence of chronic diseases is higher each year, when billions of dollars has been poured into research to learn how to treat them. The steady increase in heart disease, diabetes, cancer, hypertension and high cholesterol is unacceptable when medical technology has significantly advanced. In order to attack the root of the problem, attention primarily be directed towards prevention rather than treatment.  It is evident that the passive form of prevention (having regular check-ups and screenings) that has been advocated, is inadequate. MHF wants to help people understand how to prevent chronic disease and live long healthy lifestyles, without the assistance of multiple medications to do so.

The United States’ population is becoming consistently more obese and disease stricken. This is especially true in our inner cities. Most inner cities have significantly more disease and obesity than their suburban counterparts. Many studies have shown that this is due to lack of access to quality food and safe areas to engage in physical activity. We have recognized the impact fitness facilities can have on communities. In flourishing metro Detroit suburbs, where there are adequate fitness facilities and quality food choices available, there is less obesity and disease. Fitness even has its own culture in these areas which adds a social component and encourages more people to be active. This is the impact we strive to have in Detroit.

The model we will introduce in Detroit, MI, one of the most obese and chronic disease stricken cities in the U.S., is a fitness facility with a community health and outreach mission that will change the fitness industry. As it stands, most fitness facilities focus inward on the member experience. Our model not only focuses on member experience, but the overall health of the surrounding community as well. Detroit is currently being revitalized by entrepreneurs and community activists that are facilitating change and trying to reshape the face of this great city back to prosperous times. We will capitalize on the national attention being given to Detroit and empower more people to live healthy lifestyles. Your support you will help us make an impact on the health of many people and spark a change in the philosophy of the fitness industry throughout the country. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $75,000.00 in funding for community health & fitness programming, relocation expenses, renovation, and equipment for our new location in Detroit, MI. Our renovations will create locker rooms , a multi-purpose group fitness room and a track. 

MHF’s perks are sure to get you motivated! They are centered on participating in and promoting the healthy lifestyle movement we seek to erupt.  From memberships and boot camp to paraphernalia and public recognition, there is something for each donor to get excited about.

MHF Starter Gear: T-Shirt and wristband

Membership:  A temporary member will get all the advantages of a regular member. Enjoy using the facility at your own accord, in addition to access to all group fitness classes during the time of your perk; including a fitness assessment and nutrition counseling to get you started.

Boot Camp: You are sure to get a good workout in at our Boot Camp.  Are you limited on time but wanting variety and a place where you can continue to challenge yourself?  Boot Camp will be a great class for you.  Open to men and women at all fitness levels, our high-intensity functional training will teach you movement fundamentals as well as complex exercises that will produce results both inside and outside of the gym!

Group Personal Training: The perfect option for you and up to three guests to enjoy a personalized workout setting.  Choose from boot camp style training, pilates or dance class.

Our number one concern is covering the cost of renovations so that our new space is operational. Therefore, in the unfortunate event of us not reaching our goal, funds will go toward the completion of renovations and we will acquire additional equipment as we grow.

The Impact

Detroit is just one urban city amongst many that are deprived the access to fitness facilities that can provide the education, coaching and accountability needed to create a healthy lifestyle. More children and adults are constantly being diagnosed with preventable chronic diseases. Each year there are technological advances being made in the healthcare industry, yet every year there are more people sick than ever. This is because most individuals practice unhealthy habits in regards to nutrition and fitness, on a daily basis. The United States invests billions of dollars every year into preventative healthcare through health screenings, shots, tests, treatment via medicine, etc. However, none of these advances seem address the root cause of disease. Most, if not all people have the onset of chronic disease gradually as they continue to live sedentary lifestyles, maintain unhealthy diets and make other decisions that promote disease. Our mission is to teach and encourage people to live healthy lifestyles; encouraging them that it isn't the chore they initially thought and that it can actually be fun! Our facility will be an environment that adds a modern element to exercising and eating healthy foods. Help us make the impact that is needed in Detroit to start a movement that spreads across the country and to the world. 

Our track record with people that come to our small location, tucked in an industrial area of a small city outside Detroit, is great. Our clients are improving every day in their health and fitness. Despite the size of our current stage, we have managed to have a significant impact in many lives. However, we would like to coach and educate many more people than we can host at our current location. Support us with your donation so we can have a larger stage to provide more beneficial programs to the city and help more people change their lives for the better.

Other Ways You Can Help

We really appreciate you taking the time to learn more about our business and the change we are creating. Whether you can contribute to our cause or not we encourage you to share our campaign with your friends on social networks and in your personal life. Thanks again for your help!

We hold firm on our stance that no reasonable explanation can confirm why the incidence and prevalence of chronic diseases is higher each year, when billions of dollars has been poured into research to learn how to treat them. The steady increase in heart disease, diabetes, cancer, hypertension and high cholesterol is unacceptable when medical technology has significantly advanced. In order to attack the root of the problem, attention primarily be directed towards prevention rather than treatment.  It is evident that the passive form of prevention (having regular check-ups and screenings) that has been advocated, is inadequate. MHF wants to help people understand how to prevent chronic disease and live long healthy lifestyles, without the assistance of multiple medications to do so.
The United States’ population is becoming consistently more obese and disease stricken. This is especially true in our inner cities. Most inner cities have significantly more disease and obesity than their suburban counterparts. Many studies have shown that this is due to lack of access to quality food and safe areas to engage in physical activity. We have recognized the impact fitness facilities can have on communities. In flourishing metro Detroit suburbs, where there are adequate fitness facilities and quality food choices available, there is less obesity and disease. Fitness even has its own culture in these areas which adds a social component and encourages more people to be active. This is the impact we strive to have in Detroit.
The model we will introduce in Detroit, MI, one of the most obese and chronic disease stricken cities in the U.S., is a fitness facility with a community health and outreach mission that will change the fitness industry. As it stands, most fitness facilities focus inward on the member experience. Our model not only focuses on member experience, but the overall health of the surrounding community as well. Detroit is currently being revitalized by entrepreneurs and community activists that are facilitating change and trying to reshape the face of this great city back to prosperous times. We will capitalize on the national attention being given to Detroit and empower more people to live healthy lifestyles. Your support you will help us make an impact on the health of many people and spark a change in the philosophy of the fitness industry throughout the country. 
What We Need & What You Get
We are seeking $75,000.00 in funding for community health & fitness programming, relocation expenses, renovation, and equipment for our new location in Detroit, MI. Our renovations will create locker rooms , a multi-purpose group fitness room and a track. 
MHF’s perks are sure to get you motivated! They are centered on participating in and promoting the healthy lifestyle movement we seek to erupt.  From memberships and boot camp to paraphernalia and public recognition, there is something for each donor to get excited about.
MHF Starter Gear: T-Shirt and wristband
Membership:  A temporary member will get all the advantages of a regular member. Enjoy using the facility at your own accord, in addition to access to all group fitness classes during the time of your perk; including a fitness assessment and nutrition counseling to get you started.
Boot Camp: You are sure to get a good workout in at our Boot Camp.  Are you limited on time but wanting variety and a place where you can continue to challenge yourself?  Boot Camp will be a great class for you.  Open to men and women at all fitness levels, our high-intensity functional training will teach you movement fundamentals as well as complex exercises that will produce results both inside and outside of the gym!
Group Personal Training: The perfect option for you and up to three guests to enjoy a personalized workout setting.  Choose from boot camp style training, pilates or dance class.
Our number one concern is covering the cost of renovations so that our new space is operational. Therefore, in the unfortunate event of us not reaching our goal, funds will go toward the completion of renovations and we will acquire additional equipment as we grow.
The Impact
Detroit is just one urban city amongst many that are deprived the access to fitness facilities that can provide the education, coaching and accountability needed to create a healthy lifestyle. More children and adults are constantly being diagnosed with preventable chronic diseases. Each year there are technological advances being made in the healthcare industry, yet every year there are more people sick than ever. This is because most individuals practice unhealthy habits in regards to nutrition and fitness, on a daily basis. The United States invests billions of dollars every year into preventative healthcare through health screenings, shots, tests, treatment via medicine, etc. However, none of these advances seem address the root cause of disease. Most, if not all people have the onset of chronic disease gradually as they continue to live sedentary lifestyles, maintain unhealthy diets and make other decisions that promote disease. Our mission is to teach and encourage people to live healthy lifestyles; encouraging them that it isn't the chore they initially thought and that it can actually be fun! Our facility will be an environment that adds a modern element to exercising and eating healthy foods. Help us make the impact that is needed in Detroit to start a movement that spreads across the country and to the world. 
Our track record with people that come to our small location, tucked in an industrial area of a small city outside Detroit, is great. Our clients are improving every day in their health and fitness. Despite the size of our current stage, we have managed to have a significant impact in many lives. However, we would like to coach and educate many more people than we can host at our current location. Support us with your donation so we can have a larger stage to provide more beneficial programs to the city and help more people change their lives for the better.
Other Ways You Can Help
We really appreciate you taking the time to learn more about our business and the change we are creating. Whether you can contribute to our cause or not we encourage you to share our campaign with your friends on social networks and in your personal life. Thanks again for your help!

story:
The Story

In December of 2011, my baby daughter was born (Dana). My life changed forever. I was already in loved with my daughter since the first moment I found out I was going to be a father but when I saw her for the first time, it was amazing. I do not have words to describe this. One of the happiest moments in my life.... My daughter is amazing, so beautiful, smart, she cares for everyone. Is incredible how such a small little person, can do so many good things in your life.

....but then, the problems started.....

Since she was born, my wife and I realized that Dana had a lot of issues to sleep. She was always feeling uncomfortable and crying all the time. We spent many days/nights at the Hospital without been able to figure out what was wrong with her. After visiting many doctors, they were able to determine that Dana suffers from a rare disease that is very similar to something call Celiac Disease (Doctors think this is the evolution of this disease) in which she processes vitamins and proteins the opposite way, causing problems on the way the internal organs work and, because she is so little, the internal organs have not being develop/growing in the way they should. We have already gone thru one surgery 4 months ago where the doctors had to remove part of her intestine due to malfunction (one of the most difficult moments for me and my family).

Your Help Is needed

The Treatment is very expensive (over $100K). We are missing over $20,000!

Why?

The treatment that can help her with this disease unfortunately the medical insurance does not covers it. Of course, this is money I don´t have. The treatment started last September and ends in March. By then, we need to have the full amount paid or she won´t be able to finish the treatment, which could have a rebound effect on my daughter making things even worse for her.

I´ve been doing everything I can to raise this money... I sold my car, we sold everything in our home that could be sold like furniture, microwave, TVs, etc, currently I have like 4 jobs (work as Program Manager during the day, at night I work at a Contact Center, over the weekends I sell cars at a friend´s local dealer, I also sell Herbalife products and cosmetics). I´ve asked for personal loans, max out credit cards... anything to be able to get to the goal amount but I´m still short. I have had a lot of problems with my wife to the point that we are thinking about getting a divorce. Friends look at me at work and they always make the same comment: "what´s with the face?" All I can do is smile and move on, they have no idea how exhausted and stress I feel.

Other Ways You Can Help

So please, please please, anything you can do to help.... make donation, tell your friends/co-workers, your community, church - or help with prayers, we will appreciate it forever.

I know that some people dream on seeing their kids graduating from University, becoming Doctors, Lawyers, etc.... all I want is to see my dauther grow.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Wayne Purdy and my family needs your help. On Saturday January 25th, my brother-in-law, Bob Schultz, suffered a serious heart attack. Thankfully, my sister, Christa, and mother were able to perform CPR, saving his life until the paramedics arrived. Bob was taken to hospital and placed into a medically induced coma and onto life support. He remained in that state for nearly two weeks. Meanwhile, complications occurred. He contracted pneumonia, sepsis, c diff, and most tragically, a rare spinal stroke. The stoke has left swelling midway up his spine, preventing him breathing successfully on his own. He is still on life support and in critical care.  The stroke had left him paralyzed, though we don't yet know the full extent. He's currently undergoing a plasma exchange, and we're hopeful that this will help him regain at least some of his mobility. 

This has been an emotional roller coaster for our family, for Christa in particular. She has taken a leave of absence from her job, but the bills are piling up. We need your help. Bob is a good man. He's a strong, proud, gentle, and humble man and his love for my sister has been unmatched. My wish for them is that during Bob's convalescence, they don't have to worry about the impending financial burden.   

What We Need & What You Get

We don't know yet the full extent of Bob's injuries. His heart is strong, but the real concern now is his mobility. We have to come to grips with his new reality; he will likely never walk again. This fundraiser will not cover all the costs, bit it will help immeasurably. Christa spends all her time with bob,commuting two hours to see him in hospital. The anguish of seeing him hooked up to a myriad of machines often leaves her in tears, but she is steadfast in her support. She committed to him in sickness and in health, and she'll not break that vow. 

Bob will need his home to be wheelchair accessible. A ramp will need to be built, and rooms modified to accommodate his needs, including a bathroom that he will be able to use independently.

I understand these are hard times for everyone, and money is scarce. Bob and Christa still have each other. It reinforces the importance of love, and family, and health. Money is important, but it is hardly the most important thing. 

For every donation of $25, we will offer a heart charm to remind us all of the things in life that are truly important. 

If you are unable to help financially, that's fine. I ask that you include Bob in your prayers. We trust in God to bring him home, and that's what really matters. Please share this fundraiser with as many people as you can. Make some noise and let's help Bob and Christa. 

Thank you everyone!

story:
This campaign is now closed! Please head on over to our next campaign here! Thanks to all who do donated!


Short Summary

Hi there! My name is Tyra Brown, and I want to do something good in the world. This campaign is my brainchild, after a night going through my self-care kit and creating one for my friends. Some things about myself: I am a two-time suicide attempt survivor. I have struggled with depression and anxiety my whole life. I have self-harmed, I have self-medicated. I have done really destructive things in order to stop hurting. And I realized that was not how to handle my life. The concept of self-care kits is increasing in popularity as we realize the extent of mental illness in our society and culture. I know that there was a great personal need to help myself and my SC kit has been a literal lifesaver. So I wanted to bring the idea to the public and hopefully find some backing to provide SC kits to those who need them, for as little as shipping costs.

What We Need & What You Get

So, what I (and some of my friends who are aiding me in my little venture) need: 

I want to raise as much as I can to create at the very least, 100 SC kits. That's my short-term goal! I also want to be able to build a website, and increase the online presence to make sure that my idea is available and readily known.

The kit will include: 

Homemade glitter jars

Beanie bags (like a stress ball, but easier for tactile grounding), homemade

Inspirational quotes

Incense and a burner

Bubbles

Positive affirmations

Meditation tips

A safety plan worksheet

A small, inexpensive mp3 player, preloaded with meditation guides and relaxing music

Also, a sheet including ideas of things to add to your kit on your own, as well as books and other resources to look into

WHAT YOU GET (this is the good stuff, I know): Well, the satisfaction of helping people be better able to help themselves!

Also, there will be perks at various stages of donation, like personalized videos, and signs! I'm even working on t-shirts!

The Impact

So, hopefully, you've already understood what the intended impact is. I want to help people. I want to help people help themselves. Mental illness is so common, and often a silent struggle. The idea that there are teenagers, young adults, and adults out there holding so much pain within them is disheartening. Hopefully, spreading the word about mental illness will create a discussion on how to help those in need. Anxiety, depression, bipolar disorder, sensory processing disorders...all of these are very real struggles, and these kits can help people remember that someone wants them to get better.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know money is tight! I would love for you to contribute in any way you can, so spreading the word is always helpful. Use the indiegogo share buttons, write a blog post, assault your Facebook friends with my campaign on the regular!

Also, if you have any ideas that you think you could add to the list of extra items to add to the SC kit, please feel free to let me know. Any input is appreciated.

PLEASE DESIGN OUR LOGO!! I want something incorporating the name With Love, and a heart, plus a green/lime-green ribbon for mental health awareness.

story:
Short Summary

For the past 13 years we have been providing these children with amazing camps.  Some of the original campers are still attending, a few of them as staff.  The children literally count the days from one camp to the next.  

This year's theme is Lifeway's "Colossal Coaster World".  It is out desire to have at least one carnival ride for them to experience as this will be a novelty for the majority of them.

The children pray for their sponsors and are very thanful for your kindness.  Know that your donation will be appreciated.

What We Need & What You Get

We are starting a preliminary fundraising campaign for the month of April as a jump start to our fundraising goal. Please help us reach our goal for April of $5000

We need to raise enough money by the end of June to send 350 kids to camp. All your generous dontations go toward making this camp possible for the kids. They have games, songs, Bible stories, crafts, healthy meals and plenty of fresh water, snacks, prizes, swimming and the most memorable part of their year!! 

You have the honor and satisfaction of providing an amazing camp experience for these kids. As well as the honor of praying for them. Don't forget your donations are completely tax deductable.

The Impact

We have the oportunity to make an eternal difference for Christ in the hearts of these kids!!.

Other Ways You Can Help

Pray!! 

Pray for safety!

Pray for the children!

Consider volunteering for our 2014 camp!
