I have applied for a Business Loan for NextGen Software projects as well as Y4A. So fingers crossed with that...2. If we do not get the loan then can anyone help raise the money needed for the show? Again, I can repay this if necessary.3. Staff needed for Y4A to help run it....4. Funding for Y4A, we are eligible for all sorts of funding, but we just need someone to go and get it...We also need the Business Plan finishing so we can register as a charity...I would do it but at the moment I am doing all I can to survive and keep my head above water so I need to focus on what is guaranteed to make me money but I am even struggling with that since I only get a couple of hours a day tops between rests and trying to keep myself alive since I live on my own and some days just cooking is hard let alone cleaning, my place is quite a state at the moment.I am also applying for personal loans too, anything I can do to buy myself sometime to try and make a full recovery...I am trying to stay positive and optimistic and really do not want to see my dream of Y4A go down the pan.Sharon, the person who was going to be doing the training over here is now nearly fully booked for next year, she was suppose to be coming over in Dec or Jan. But we need those 10 teachers first...After the show everyone wants to do yoga for their ASD pupile/patients, etc but since we can not yet provide they are going elsewhere, which is why I think Sharon is getting booked up...So if we are to keep Y4A going we need to act NOW. No more time to waste, this is it, make or break time...I was hoping if we all worked together we can somehow keep this dream alive?Please help me keep the dream alive... :)Would be greatly appreciated.Many thanks,David Ellams BSc(Hons)Mangaging Director & FounderY4A.http://yoga4autism.org/shows/om-yoga-show-staff-funding-needed-to-help-save-y4a/

 
Many thanks and gratitude.David Ellams BSc(Hons)Founder & Managing DirectorYoga4Autism.

story:
Nuts & Bolts

On June 2, 2013 I began hiking the Finger Lakes Trail in upstate New York. My fundraising goal for this first hike is to raise some money for the places that made this possible to one extent or another. Your contribution will impact Weill Cornell Medical College Department of Urology (funding Dr. Richard Lee's research as well as a scholarship fund for interns--saw many of these while in hospital), University of Vienna, Austria (Dr. Shahrokh Shariat organized an amazing surgical team who worked on me for nearly 10 hours last summer, giving me and my kidneys a chance at a longer life span), and finally an outstanding local hospital: Crouse Hospital (the area’s certified Regional Perinatal Center offering care for regional spina bifida births).

Please comment on your contribution or on the home page which organization you want to support! Visit www.kimo342.com to read more about Thad and to get updates and great pictures from the trail.

What You Get

That warm, fuzzy feeling that comes from knowing you’ve done good. In addition, Thad felt strongly about giving something to those who want it. Please help yourself to one of the perks! It's mostly for those near to New York but everyone needs a vacation now and then, right?

What We Need

Thad has been through hell and back. Those of you who know us personally can attest to this (if you don't know us, visit Face it). A life of spina bifida myelomeningocele is not easy. Most people born with this, especially in the late 60s, are not ambulatory or not alive at all. The surgery he had last summer marked the fourth major surgery of his life. Did you know? Even though Thad can walk, he’s really only walking on one leg. Check out the photo. His right leg is visibly shorter and smaller than the left. He has an underdeveloped calf muscle, claw foot, and is a couple inches shorter on this side. He’s already noted some pain for pushing this leg and the hike has just begun. So, why? He is passionate about the subtitle of his page: “moving forward with diligence” (a quote from Buddhism) and bringing awareness to bladder cancer (often recipients of urostomy surgeries—in his case, his bladder never developed at all), spina bifida, and urostomy in general. He’s changing his bag in the wild! Inspirational? While this is a word he eschews due to modesty, we live it every day.

Please help us meet this minimum goal. No amount is too small. Times are tough. We get it. We struggle too. But these causes are worth the sacrifice of 560 miles and over 30 days without seeing your wife and kids (well, okay, we'll see him a few times on the trail, but you get the idea). Any contribution is greatly appreciated! Amounts not connected to one of the three causes will be divided equally between the three.

story:
First of all this is not a prank. It's a sensitive issue, and we felt the best way to go is to have fun with it. What man has the balls to ask the Internet in general to help him get a vasectomy?

The backstory:
My wife of 15 years had a difficult birth with our last child, and asked me to consider a vasectomy. It was at her suggestion that we start this campaign. Originally it was as a carrot; anything over the vasectomy funds would go to “toys” for me (and by toys I mean a new motorcycle). As it turns out, we have a rather large move ahead of us, so the toys get to wait, but this would be prime opportunity to fund our move, and who knows what else.

Why in the world would I invite you to kick my nuts?
Well, for one, the humor value. It’s not often someone actually asks to be kicked in the nuts. More practically however, I don't have insurance. I don't qualify for medicaid, and as a contract employee medical insurance is not available. Starting this fund is hopefully a fun way for us to 'fix' that.

So, say I give you this kick - what’s your plan?
The vasectomy itself is $1000 with follow up visits with Dr. Chopp. This is our primary goal, and anything over it is just gravy. Another $1000, is for other things I want / need at home while I heal and cover indiegogo fees.

  • If we reach $5000, we’ll buy a new (to us) vehicle for people moving after the vasectomy. 
  • If we hit $10,000 we’ll use it to help us with our move closer to family.
  • If you all really love kicking my nuts, I promise you any money above those goals will go towards awesomely fun things™ for the children.

Investing in our fund to kick my nuts in also an investment in the future of our family.

Ok, I’m in. What’s in it for me?
For any donation you get a heartfelt Thank you from both of us, mostly from my wife.

  • For any donation over $100 You will be sent a handwritten thank you note (awww)
  • For any donation over $500 You will be sent a Dr. Dick Chopp t-shirt. ( Pending Approval )
  • For any donation over $1000 We will include your name/business name as a bumper sticker on our car ( For a limited time only )

One last request:
Even if you don’t feel like donating, please share this fundraiser far and wide. The more people who see it, the more people who might, *just might* kick in a few $. Everyone’s nuts should get their 15 minutes of Internet fame, don’t you think?


The Appointment is to be scheduled with Dr. Richard ‘Dick’ Chopp in Austin, Texas. Yes, that's a real doctor, and his real name.

  •  http://www.urologyteam.com/node/2

story:
About the Project

This November I have a very special opportunity to volunteer as a photographer to help StoveTeam International document the work that they are doing in Honduras to bring clean cookstoves to families in need.

During this trip, I will interview and photograph stove users and discover how their lives have been changed by the stove. I will also photograph the inside of homes to document the damage done by open fire cooking, both to a home and the women who cook.

All of this will enable StoveTeam, which is a small non-profit with one paid staff person, to use my photos, audio recordings, and videos to generate support for their programs and better inform people in the United States about the important work they are doing.

About StoveTeam International

StoveTeam promotes a safe, highly efficient cookstove called the Ecocina by helping entrepreneurs in developing countries establish sustainable, locally owned and operated stove factories to make and sell Ecocina stoves. These stoves have dramatically changed the lives of over 150,000 people in a positive way. The burns and respiratory illnesses women and children too often suffer are eliminated by the stove, as it emits no smoke and reduces the emissions of harmful carbon and particulate matter by more than 70%. Since 2007, StoveTeam has helped entrepreneurs establish six factories in five countries, resulting in the distribution of over 27,000 stoves.

I hope you will join me in supporting this important project. Your support will allow me to help StoveTeam International tell the very needed stories of how a stove can help to reverse and prevent the serious environmental and health problems caused by open fire cooking.

This stove project changes lives and you can help. If you would like to learn more about StoveTeam, you can visit their website at www.stoveteam.org.

My Budget

My travel costs are set at $950, with camera equipment costs estimated at $700. I will be purchasing some lightweight stabilizing gear, and audio recording equipment, to supplement the gear I have already purchased independently. If I exceed my initial fundraising goals, I will use the money to fund fuel-efficient stoves for families in Central America.

♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥

Please note that your financial support does not have to end with the close of this campaign. Contributions will still be accepted and can be paid directly into our account at:

Garden of Light Ibiza CB

IBAN:ES8821000755060200045274

BIC/SWIFT: CAIXESBBXXX

Address:

La Caixa

Sant Miquel

D Eivissa, 6

07815 Sant Miquel de Balansat

♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥

WHAT IS THE GARDEN OF LIGHT IBIZA?

Hidden away in a valley surrounded by Mother Nature and her healings properties, The Garden of Light Ibiza, has been licensed as a school of Yoga and Human Development, for the past 18 years. It is situated in San Miguel, in the north of Ibiza, very close to the famous 'Benirras Beach'. You can escape from the outside world and be transported to this magical sanctuary of natural beauty, simplicity, tranquility.....BLISS!! 

           

Lourdes is the heart and soul of ‘The Garden of Light’. Born in Bilbao, loving simplicity and nature, she has been living in the countryside of Ibiza for more than 30 years. For the past 18 years, Lourdes, with the love and support of many wonderful beings, has created an oasis of transformation, 'The Garden of Light'.  Her passion to improve human conditions and to discover the mysteries of life, brought her to experiment and connect with a wide variety of different teachings, techniques, philosophies, masters, etc... We are proud to be continuing and growing the wonderful work that Lourdes has started and having her as part of our family.      

We are a small family run community with a beautiful vision. Our team is one of our strongest assets. They not just staff, they are an integral part of the Center, sharing with the guests their knowledge, beliefs, experiences, support and friendship whilst allowing for their own personal and spiritual journey to thrive. We have an award winning background in running Spiritual Development Retreats as ‘Psychic Retreats’ both Ibiza and the UK.
   
Our retreats have excellent levels of customer service with a high majority of guests reporting life-changing experiences. This really speaks volumes about the experience, care and service we offer our guests, prior to, during and after the retreat. We have been working and living here, at the Garden of Light Ibiza, for the past 8 months. During this time we have been visualizing and working hard to create a sanctuary of sacred spaces for meditating, healing, spiritual and personal growth.
 
 
We aspire to bring many different forms of healing, spiritual, self-development and inspirational life changing workshops to the Garden of Light Ibiza. By raising awareness, we can raise spiritual vibrations and learn to view the world around us and how we live in it, from a new perspective.
 
 
By combining all aspects of our lives, such as the way we live harmoniously as a family, our use of solar power to generate electricity, planting many gardens to grow our own food, eventually raising chickens and horses, using our mountain sourced water for irrigation and personal use to name a few, will help reduce our combined carbon footsteps. 
 
 
As well as hosting our own retreats, The Garden
of Light Ibiza will also be available to rent on an hourly, daily or weekly basis if you are interested in hosting your own course or special event. We are able to provide accommodations and our in house Chef will work with you to create a menu perfect for you and/or your groups needs and requirements.

 

DREAM….VISION….FUNDING....REALITY!!!!

The following is an overview of our vision and of our development plan.

The current accommodations are situated higher up the mountain side than the main Center and the dinning area. We must first create a path joining all the tiers together, creating a natural flow between the Center, the Healing Garden Spa, Red Road Lodge Healing and Treatment area, the Gardens, Casa Chakra and Balinese inspired accommodation.

      

We intend to build this pathway as organically as possible to enhance the beauty and functionality of the nature all around us, using stones and materials from the land wherever possible, as well as recyclable and recycled materials. Providing areas for relaxation, meditation, swimming or seating to just to rest and chill for a moment whilst overlooking beautiful mountain-views.

 

The Casa Chakra is our only accommodation, which allows for a maximum capacity of 15 people in a five bedroom finca. Therefore to increase our occupancy, we intend to renovate the 'Casa Curazon' into a self-contained suite, consisting of a kitchenette/lounge, bedroom and en-suite eco wet room. Ideally suited as a separate space for teacher accommodation or for those wishing more privacy. Lounge also provides extra sleeping accommodations. Funds will also be required to dress up the Casa Chakra, as well as all of the necessary fixtures such as beds, wardrobes, lamps and bedding etc...

 
 
In order to accommodate groups of 30 or more we are building 10 Balinese inspired structures. Six of these will share eco toilets and eco showers whereas the remaining will have en-suite eco bathrooms. These  structures will be built on 3 separate tiers, as to blend into the secluded forest, providing a natural canopy on the mountainside by a natural spring ensuring complete privacy for our guests.
 
The eco showers will be constructed with recyclable materials. This entire area will be supplied with electricity, powered by a Keshe generator, the latest advancement in powercell technology.
 
 
                    
 
The structure adjoining the Casa Chakra will also be renewed into living accommodations for full time staff ensuring the continuity of the care and service for our guests. This area will require a complete renovation including wiring, new roof, skylights, new windows, painting and to build a shared eco bathroom. The outer area will be cleared to provide outdoor seating and chill area.
                                                                      
              
We have excellent Chefs who work on improving how we prepare our food, using only the best organic produce here on the island and working with the 'Blood Group' eating plan, whenever possible. When working with Body, Mind and Spirit, experience has shown us that the easier it is for one to digest, the more one's energy can then be used in healing the body and raising one's spiritual vibration.
                                                               
       
 
Planting our own organic vegetable gardens and fruit trees will not only allow our Chefs to prepare meals for our guests with the freshest of organic ingredients but will also bring us one step closer to achieving our goal of self-sustainability. Our vision is to develop the farmland on 10/12 tiers, which contain some of the best soil on the island, for our gardens. All gardens will be watered via an irrigation system fed from a natural mountain top spring.
 
Red Road Lodge, the Shamanic Healing and Treatment area is situated below the vegetable gardens. Guided by her Vision Quest on the land, this location was chosen and sacredly blessed by Bear Medicine Song, our Shamanic Healer. These two levels are dedicated to Shamanic Healing, Sweat Lodges and Fire-Walking and many other sacred ceremonies, all lead by Bear Medicine Song. Funds are required to purchase materials to complete the Red Road Lodge, Sweat Lodge and landscaping of the surrounding area. The Fire-Walking level requires grading and seating to be built.
 
          

The Garden of Healing is a unique, outdoor healing center drawing inspiration from its surroundings, Mother Nature herself. Simply by just being in nature nurtures our soul! At The Garden of Healing we will provide a safe, loving and  supportive environment for you to heal, learn, grow and transform yourself.

 

Four levels will be developed for the creation of the ‘The Garden of Healing' spa. The first level, highlights the existing Balinese inspired structure which is to be refurbished as a reception area. Further along, the path ushers us to the existing eco-bathroom with solar shower for guests to freshen up before or after treatment.

         

The continuing path to the second level takes us to the entrance of the treatment area, setting the scene with a shallow pond with waterfall features, crossed via stepping-stones steering you through a flower-covered pergola to the spa area. Funds are essential here to create the Spa from start to finish including the structures, ponds, water features, furnishing, linens, robes, towels, oils etc... On the far side of the treatment site, a set of stairs will be built to access our Sea Salt Plunge pool, on the third tier. The existing reservoir requires a complete re-vamping and seating built along the inner edges of the pool, providing an area to relax and detoxify after treatment, as well as, decking for the outer perimeter of the pool. The focal point on the fourth tier is yet again, another reservoir, which will need to be re-built as most of it has crumbled away. This pool will be infused with crystals for their healing properties.

                  

The kitchen in the main house will also undergo a complete refurbishment to allow us to create a safer and more efficient work environment for our Chefs. 

Last but not least, we will level and grade the roadway leading into Garden of Light Ibiza, as well as the entrance and road leading to the public parking area and the parking area itself. We will have to sub-contract the work out or rent heavy machinery for the work to be completed in a professional manner, either way, a costly project but one that will enhance our guest’s arrival to our sanctuary. The driveway and entrance will need sprucing upwith plants, flowers and shrubberies, as well as, erecting a new gated structure securing the property.

 
Another facet of the abundance offered to us by the land, is our own water supply, from a mountain fed source.  The development consists of the capping of the reservoir, as well as having a filtering system installed to remove excess minerals, providing us with clear, clean, refreshing mountain drinking water. The reservoir will also supply water to our eco bathrooms throughout the property, as well as, our garden irrigation system.
 
                  
 
A point of pride for us is that we operate on solar power energy. This is another area we wish to develop further by educating ourselves and by helping to educate others on how to live a more self-sustainable and ecological life. Our intentions are to have solar lighting throughout the outdoor areas, such as entrance to the property, driveway, parking lot, terraces, pathways and pools, waterfalls, heated water supply for eco bathrooms, as well as providing guests with solar pads for charging their phones and computers, so pretty much wherever we can. We are also exploring the possibility of generating our own energy supply using turbines and the running mountain water.
 
It is our mission to continue and build on to the wonderful work and vision of Lourdes, allowing the Garden of Light Ibiza to grow organically, with the introduction of a variety of new workshops. We aspire to create safe spaces for individuals who may be in a vulnerable situation or very fragile, we want to continue to support every aspect of the human mind, body, and spirit. With the premise, licensed as a private school for Yoga and Human Development, the possibilities for the types of retreats, workshops and events we will be able to offer, are only limited by our collective imaginations!
 

HERE’S WHERE WE NEED YOU!

Our target is $100,000.00..........."Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much" Helen Keller

We need your financial help in completing this wonderful project although all forms of donation are welcome.

  • Tell your friends, family, colleagues, neighbours.
  • Visit and like our Facebook pages
  • Follow us on Twitter
  • Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs and other social media sites.

If you believe in what we are doing, SPREAD THE MESSAGE!

Your financial donation or investment towards the development would be greatly appreciated. However, if you not in a position to support us financially there are many ways you can get personally involved. Including but not limited to: donating your expertise and/or skills in areas such as business strategy; financial planning; accountancy; business plan development; architecture; as well as, builders, plumbers, electricians, gardeners, masons or general labour.

All perks are of equal or greater value of the donation tendered. Please note: the cost of the perk is listed in U.S. currency and will be converted into currency of your choice at the time of donation. Unless otherwise stated all perks are vaild until October 31st, 2014 and are transferable. See PERKS for the complete list of the fantastic perks offered for your donation.

NOTE: you can donate anonymously or block the amount contributed if you wish, and you may choose another amount of your choice if you prefer, by hitting "contribute now" and scroll to the bottom and then select, "no perk, just contribution" and type in any amount.  Indiegogo.com is a SECURE site via credit/debit or Paypal.
 
The funds we receive will be equitably managed and invested for the greatest benefit of the Garden of Light Ibiza's most appropriate and advantageous development.
 
Please help us to bring this wonderful vision into reality, for everyone worldwide, to benefit from its growth and development. With your help, we can bring this dream from a vision into a reality.  

          We Are ♥ One Mind ♥ One Voice ♥ One Heart

During this time we have been visualizing and working hard to create a sanctuary of sacred spaces for meditating, healing, spiritual and personal growth.

 
 





















We aspire to bring many different forms of healing, spiritual, self-development and inspirational life changing workshops to the Garden of Light Ibiza. By raising awareness, we can raise spiritual vibrations and learn to view the world around us and how we live in it, from a new perspective.

 
 



















By combining all aspects of our lives, such as the way we live harmoniously as a family, our use of solar power to generate electricity, planting many gardens to grow our own food, eventually raising chickens and horses, using our mountain sourced water for irrigation and personal use to name a few, will help reduce our combined carbon footsteps. 

 
 














As well as hosting our own retreats, The Garden
of Light Ibiza will also be available to rent on an hourly, daily or weekly basis if you are interested in hosting your own course or special event. We are able to provide accommodations and our in house Chef will work with you to create a menu perfect for you and/or your groups needs and requirements.
 
DREAM….VISION….FUNDING....REALITY!!!!
The following is an overview of our vision and of our development plan.
The current accommodations are situated higher up the mountain side than the main Center and the dinning area. We must first create a path joining all the tiers together, creating a natural flow between the Center, the Healing Garden Spa, Red Road Lodge Healing and Treatment area, the Gardens, Casa Chakra and Balinese inspired accommodation.

      
We intend to build this pathway as organically as possible to enhance the beauty and functionality of the nature all around us, using stones and materials from the land wherever possible, as well as recyclable and recycled materials. Providing areas for relaxation, meditation, swimming or seating to just to rest and chill for a moment whilst overlooking beautiful mountain-views.
 

The Casa Chakra is our only accommodation, which allows for a maximum capacity of 15 people in a five bedroom finca. Therefore to increase our occupancy, we intend to renovate the 'Casa Curazon' into a self-contained suite, consisting of a kitchenette/lounge, bedroom and en-suite eco wet room. Ideally suited as a separate space for teacher accommodation or for those wishing more privacy. Lounge also provides extra sleeping accommodations. Funds will also be required to dress up the Casa Chakra, as well as all of the necessary fixtures such as beds, wardrobes, lamps and bedding etc...
 
 

In order to accommodate groups of 30 or more we are building 10 Balinese inspired structures. Six of these will share eco toilets and eco showers whereas the remaining will have en-suite eco bathrooms. These  structures will be built on 3 separate tiers, as to blend into the secluded forest, providing a natural canopy on the mountainside by a natural spring ensuring complete privacy for our guests.
 
The eco showers will be constructed with recyclable materials. This entire area will be supplied with electricity, powered by a Keshe generator, the latest advancement in powercell technology.


 

 

                     

 
The structure adjoining the Casa Chakra will also be renewed into living accommodations for full time staff ensuring the continuity of the care and service for our guests. This area will require a complete renovation including wiring, new roof, skylights, new windows, painting and to build a shared eco bathroom. The outer area will be cleared to provide outdoor seating and chill area.
                                                                      
              
We have excellent Chefs who work on improving how we prepare our food, using only the best organic produce here on the island and working with the 'Blood Group' eating plan, whenever possible. When working with Body, Mind and Spirit, experience has shown us that the easier it is for one to digest, the more one's energy can then be used in healing the body and raising one's spiritual vibration.


                                                               

        

 
Planting our own organic vegetable gardens and fruit trees will not only allow our Chefs to prepare meals for our guests with the freshest of organic ingredients but will also bring us one step closer to achieving our goal of self-sustainability. Our vision is to develop the farmland on 10/12 tiers, which contain some of the best soil on the island, for our gardens. All gardens will be watered via an irrigation system fed from a natural mountain top spring.

 
Red Road Lodge, the Shamanic Healing and Treatment area is situated below the vegetable gardens. Guided by her Vision Quest on the land, this location was chosen and sacredly blessed by Bear Medicine Song, our Shamanic Healer. These two levels are dedicated to Shamanic Healing, Sweat Lodges and Fire-Walking and many other sacred ceremonies, all lead by Bear Medicine Song. Funds are required to purchase materials to complete the Red Road Lodge, Sweat Lodge and landscaping of the surrounding area. The Fire-Walking level requires grading and seating to be built.
 
            

The Garden of Healing is a unique, outdoor healing center drawing inspiration from its surroundings, Mother Nature herself. Simply by just being in nature nurtures our soul! At The Garden of Healing we will provide a safe, loving and  supportive environment for you to heal, learn, grow and transform yourself.

  

Four levels will be developed for the creation of the ‘The Garden of Healing' spa. The first level, highlights the existing Balinese inspired structure which is to be refurbished as a reception area. Further along, the path ushers us to the existing eco-bathroom with solar shower for guests to freshen up before or after treatment.
          
The continuing path to the second level takes us to the entrance of the treatment area, setting the scene with a shallow pond with waterfall features, crossed via stepping-stones steering you through a flower-covered pergola to the spa area. Funds are essential here to create the Spa from start to finish including the structures, ponds, water features, furnishing, linens, robes, towels, oils etc... On the far side of the treatment site, a set of stairs will be built to access our Sea Salt Plunge pool, on the third tier. The existing reservoir requires a complete re-vamping and seating built along the inner edges of the pool, providing an area to relax and detoxify after treatment, as well as, decking for the outer perimeter of the pool. The focal point on the fourth tier is yet again, another reservoir, which will need to be re-built as most of it has crumbled away. This pool will be infused with crystals for their healing properties.
                    

The kitchen in the main house will also undergo a complete refurbishment to allow us to create a safer and more efficient work environment for our Chefs. 
Last but not least, we will level and grade the roadway leading into Garden of Light Ibiza, as well as the entrance and road leading to the public parking area and the parking area itself. We will have to sub-contract the work out or rent heavy machinery for the work to be completed in a professional manner, either way, a costly project but one that will enhance our guest’s arrival to our sanctuary. The driveway and entrance will need sprucing upwith plants, flowers and shrubberies, as well as, erecting a new gated structure securing the property.

 
Another facet of the abundance offered to us by the land, is our own water supply, from a mountain fed source.  The development consists of the capping of the reservoir, as well as having a filtering system installed to remove excess minerals, providing us with clear, clean, refreshing mountain drinking water. The reservoir will also supply water to our eco bathrooms throughout the property, as well as, our garden irrigation system.
 
                    

 
A point of pride for us is that we operate on solar power energy. This is another area we wish to develop further by educating ourselves and by helping to educate others on how to live a more self-sustainable and ecological life. Our intentions are to have solar lighting throughout the outdoor areas, such as entrance to the property, driveway, parking lot, terraces, pathways and pools, waterfalls, heated water supply for eco bathrooms, as well as providing guests with solar pads for charging their phones and computers, so pretty much wherever we can. We are also exploring the possibility of generating our own energy supply using turbines and the running mountain water.
 
It is our mission to continue and build on to the wonderful work and vision of Lourdes, allowing the Garden of Light Ibiza to grow organically, with the introduction of a variety of new workshops. We aspire to create safe spaces for individuals who may be in a vulnerable situation or very fragile, we want to continue to support every aspect of the human mind, body, and spirit. With the premise, licensed as a private school for Yoga and Human Development, the possibilities for the types of retreats, workshops and events we will be able to offer, are only limited by our collective imaginations!
 
HERE’S WHERE WE NEED YOU!
Our target is $100,000.00..........."Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much" Helen Keller

We need your financial help in completing this wonderful project although all forms of donation are welcome.

Tell your friends, family, colleagues, neighbours.
Visit and like our Facebook pages
Follow us on Twitter
Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs and other social media sites.
If you believe in what we are doing, SPREAD THE MESSAGE!
Your financial donation or investment towards the development would be greatly appreciated. However, if you not in a position to support us financially there are many ways you can get personally involved. Including but not limited to: donating your expertise and/or skills in areas such as business strategy; financial planning; accountancy; business plan development; architecture; as well as, builders, plumbers, electricians, gardeners, masons or general labour.
All perks are of equal or greater value of the donation tendered. Please note: the cost of the perk is listed in U.S. currency and will be converted into currency of your choice at the time of donation. Unless otherwise stated all perks are vaild until October 31st, 2014 and are transferable. See PERKS for the complete list of the fantastic perks offered for your donation.

NOTE: you can donate anonymously or block the amount contributed if you wish, and you may choose another amount of your choice if you prefer, by hitting "contribute now" and scroll to the bottom and then select, "no perk, just contribution" and type in any amount.  Indiegogo.com is a SECURE site via credit/debit or Paypal.
 
The funds we receive will be equitably managed and invested for the greatest benefit of the Garden of Light Ibiza's most appropriate and advantageous development.
 
Please help us to bring this wonderful vision into reality, for everyone worldwide, to benefit from its growth and development. With your help, we can bring this dream from a vision into a reality.  

          We Are ♥ One Mind ♥ One Voice ♥ One Heart

story:
What is PEEPLECHASE?

PEEPLECHASE is a brand-new obstacle course race series based on the Track & Field Steeplechase Event, and is the brainchild of our founder Tommy Benedetti

PEEPLECHASE is a 3000 meter foot-race on grass over 30 of the World's Most Beautiful Obstacles

The concept calls for Participants to run 2 Heats (competitive or non-competitive), plus an optional 3rd Bonus Heat for Charity.  The model calls for providing music, food, t-shirts, and more! 

  • Our founder has invested (lost?) well over $100,000 and thousands of hours of his life in trying to bring PEEPLECHASE to the People

  • We have had more than 30 beautiful obstacles custom-created by the best of the best in the industry; rented facilities that ultimately had to be cancelled; spent considerable $$$ on advertising, sponsorships and promotions; hired awesome marketing people and graphic designers; built a website; along with the various other costly activites necessary to make an event like this work

  • Despite overwhelming positive feedback (more than 10,000 folks have liked us so far on Facebook, along with substantial Event Registrations by real people enthusiastic about our idea in 14 Different Cities), our idea has not gained the immediate traction that we had hoped for, and which is necessary to put on an exciting event

  • In order to provide additional time for marketing activities and additional fundraising, and due to the limited size of our fields at our early events, PEEPLECHASE has regrettably cancelled the first 10 of our 14 events, issuing full refunds (and apologies and thanks) to all of our participants

Please Help Get PEEPLECHASE off the Ground...

We are hoping to raise $50,000 to help us continue to get the word out about our concept.  We are satisfied that the PEEPLECHASE concept is viable based on the overwhelmingly positive public reaction that we have received so far.  Nevertheless, we could use some help from kind people...

  • People that contribute $20 or more will receive a Stylish PEEPLECHASE T-Shirt (as well as our enduring gratitude!)

  • People that contribute $100 or more will receive a Stylish PEEPLECHASE Ballcap (as well as our enduring gratitude!)

  • People that contribute $1000 or more will receive a Stylish PEEPLECHASE Cashmere (as well as our enduring gratitude!)

  • While there are no guarantees that we can get our concept any higher off the ground than we have already, contributions from Awesome People like you sure would help!

  • We have given our all to this point and will continue doing so.  We will either know "the triumph of high achievement" or "fail while daring greatly." Either way, our place "shall never be with those cold and timid sould who know neither victory nor defeat!"

YOU Can Make a Difference!

PEEPLECHASE has involved the devotion of blood, sweat and tears of our founder, as well as the great PEEPLECHASE People.

  • PEEPLECHASE is about bringing fun and beauty to the world of obstacle course racing

  • Our Founder is a humble person with a dream.  He is not a businessman in the Gordon Gekko sense.  This is not about money, but rather the idea that funding can help get this dream of a fast-paced and beautiful obstacle course race off the ground!

  • Every little bit helps...

Other Ways You Can Help...

We recognize that some people just can’t contribute cash, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help in other ways!

  • Please help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!

  • Please "share" our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank You for being AWESOME!

story: Hi, my name is Booker Bartelmay and I am a transgender man living in central Illinois. I have started this campaign so that I will be able to reach my goal and get this surgery. My insurance won't cover it and even if insurance would cover it the place that I'm going doesn't accept insurance.  I would appreciate it if you could donate  and even a $1 can help.  But even if you can't donate you can share this link with friends  an then their friends will share and hopefully more people will want to contribute.  Even though I do t have anything to offer you because I'm in a tight financial situation I would be extremely appreciative if you could at the very least share the link. Thank you and have a great day!

story:
Spring Into Yoga brings donation-based community Yoga & Zumba to NYC (and the world, through our website).

  • We have classes for adults.  Classes for kids.  Classes for everyone together, regardless of economic situation, race, religion, gender, age, ability...

    Yoga.  Zumba. Together.  Stretching.  Working out.  Relaxing.  Learning.  Having fun.  Goofy, wonderful, ecstatic fun.  Together.

  • We believe that yoga, fitness, and wellness should be inexpensive, easily accessible, fun, and done together.

  • We have been giving classes outside all summer long, and to be able to continue serving NYC, we need a space.  To continue serving others, we need to produce free web content.  To do these things, we need your help.

 

So... uh... yeah.  You are probably wondering who we are.  

  • Spring Into Yoga started with Spring Into Yoga Festival in May 2013, and then quickly exploded into the organization that exists today, giving multiple classes weekly in Prospect Park, Brooklyn, and Central Park, Manhattan.  

  • Spring Into Yoga is run by Emily Buck, with help from a group of other certified (and certifiably awesome) yoga teachers and business-types including the majestic Sterling Silverhorse (who also has the best name, maybe, ever).  

  • We are currently in the process of registering as a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization.

 

 

We are trying to get a storefront,

so that we can continue to bring classes to the community, while also creating a safe space for people to hang out, relax, and meet new friends.  We are also trying to provide free, quality content on our website to bring yoga, zumba, fitness, and community to others who are not in NYC.

 

 

Finding community in New York City is hard.  

(Surprisingly hard)

  • Do a quick Google search- there are hundreds of articles talking (and complaining) about it.  What better way to meet your neighbors than to bond over a shared passion, goal, or sweaty towel?  I can't think of any.

    Finding community elsewhere isn't a piece of cake either. Unless you are amazing at just walking up to people and talking, which most of us aren't.

     

New York City is full of millions of people, and despite this, can be so impersonal.  

  • The beauty of this place lies in the moments that the walls between strangers break down.  The moment two people smile at the subway performer.  The moment someone holds a door open for you.  The moment   you accidentally kick someone in the face in yoga class, and then they ask you out on a date as you hand them an ice pack...  

  • We need more connection to others, and we are so scared to do it out on the street, or on public transportation.  

  • When everyone is trying to get fit, relax, and enjoy a class, we have something in common.  That is the moment when conversation can start, and friendship can be born.

  

 

That is Why Spring Into Yoga Needs a Studio Location.  

 

 

 

 

  • We need approximately $10,000 to secure a storefront rental, remodel it to our standards, and pay the first two months of rent.  

  • Getting a small business loan as a brand new nonprofit in a mostly for-profit industry is a tough sell.

  • Instead, we want to turn to the community- the same community that we wish to open our classes to, in order to create this space.  A space that is for you!

  • Most of all, we need people who like our idea, and want to come take class, and use our space!  

  • In other words... we need you.  Come join our tribe.  We have free coffee (with every class!)

 

 

  • Well, most importantly, you get a great new community yoga studio, unlike any other in NYC!  

  • You get to experience taking yoga classes next to a kid.  Or your grandma. Yoga with people you wouldn't normally do yoga with.  A stretching of the mind.

  • You get a safe, community space in which to hang out and relax.

  • You get classes especially for women, men, children, seniors, and beginners, as well as our signature all ages & abilities style class.

  • You get dubstep yoga friday nights.

  • You get a free cup of coffee, tea, or water with every yoga class (yep, free caffeine!).

  • You get nifty yoga workshops.

  • You get a book swap shelf at the studio, where you can drop off your old books, and take new ones home, free of charge!  It's like give a penny, take a penny, but with books.

  • You get board game rentals!  $1 an hour for a game.  Hang out and play with a friend. (stretch goal)

  • You get community movie nights, mixers, parties, and soirees. (stretch goal)

  • You get this great schedule full of classes...

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Well, you get the best of perks!

  

With a $5 donation you receive a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  You made it happen.  You go, Glen Coco.

 

 

With a $10 donation you receive a  a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  Because, well, you rock.   You're a class act.

 

 


With a $15 donation you receive a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you. Yoga matters, and so do you!

 

 

With a $25 donation you receive a free private lesson with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.

 

 

With a $30 donation you receive a Spring Into Yoga tote bag, a free private lesson with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  Use the bag to go on awesome adventures, then come back, take class, and tell us all about it!

 

 


With a $50 donation you receive a Spring Into Yoga mug of your choice, a free private lesson with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  Use the coffee mug to stay awake while making your way around town, going to all those nifty places you go, those cool things you have to do.  Then come back for a class and fill your mug full of tea or java to relax it all away.

 

 


With a $75 donation you receive a high quality premium Spring Into Yoga t-shirt in the size and style of your choice, a two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  You'll be the most stylin kid in town with your Spring Into Yoga gear.  So cool.  You are so cool.  I kind of want to be you.

 

 


With a $90 donation you receive a limited edition Spring Into Yoga mat by Gaiam in the color of your choice.  This mat will never be for retail sale again after this campaign. You also receive two free private lessons with Emily, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on Facebook, and a hug.  Take class in style, and relax with Buddha. 

 

 

 

With a $90 donation, you receive a premium Spring Into Yoga tee in the size and style of your choice, a Spring Into Yoga tote bag, two free lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  You'll be the most fantabulous person in NYC with all of your matching stuff.  That's some amazing brand loyalty right there.  We love you.  You rock our socks.

 

 

 

With a $100 donation, you receive a high quality Spring Into Yoga hoodie in the size and style of your choice, two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  Running around town, or just walking to the post office, everyone will see you (and want to be you).  Especially everyone else in yoga class with you.

 

 

 

 

With a $140 donation, you receive a high quality Spring Into Yoga hoodie in the size and style of your choice, a Spring Into Yoga tote bag, two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  Running around town, or just walking to the post office, everyone will see you (and want to be you).  Especially everyone else in yoga class with you.

 

 

 

 

With a $175 donation, you receive a pass for 3 monthes of classes at Spring Into Yoga, two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a 3 monthes, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  And it sounds like we might be seeing you a lot.  Just think of how your abs are going to look!  Is it hot in here? 

 

 

 

With a $200 donation, you will receive a limited edition Gaiam Spring Into Yoga mat in the color of your choice, a Spring Into Yoga hoodie in the size and style of your choice,  two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a 3 monthes, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  And it sounds like we might be seeing you a lot.

 

 

 


With a $250 donation, your name will be on our donor wall in our studio, two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you!  Thanks for your generosity and being a neato yogi.  Karma will reward you generously.

 

 

 

With a $300 donation, you receive a pass for 6 monthes of classes at Spring Into Yoga, three free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for 6 monthes, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  We'll be seeing you often, for awhile.  You sexy beast, you.

 

 

 

With a $550 donation, you receive a pass for 12 monthes of classes at Spring Into Yoga, your name on the wall, three free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for 12 monthes, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  You're our new best friend.

 

 

 

We are planning to have a book swap shelf, board game rentals, a lounge area, a coffee bar, a desk, a mat rental station, and yes, even a bathroom. Get one of those named after you! Plus, get a free year of class and mat rentals, your name will be on our donor wall in our studio, two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a mug, a tee, a hoodie, a bag, a mat, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you!

 

 

 


Do you want our class to be called Billy Bob Zumba? With a $5000 donation, that right is yours! Choose a class option and get it named after you. Plus, get a free year of class and mat rentals, your name will be on our donor wall in our studio, a mug, a tee, a hoodie, a bag, a mat, two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you!

 

 


 You just singlehandedly funded our campaign.  For that, Emily is going to give you private yoga lessons once a week for the entire year.  Plus, get a free year of class and mat rentals, your name will be on our donor wall in our studio, a mug, a tee, a hoodie, a bag, a mat, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you!

 

 


We will literally name Spring Into Yoga after you.  Your name. On our storefront.  On our logo.  On towels.  You know you want your name on towels. Become a local celebrity.  We will also throw every other physical reward at you.  And chocolate.  Lots of chocolate.  You're our hero. 

 

 

 

 

 

  • We do the happiest dance ever done by anyone ever.

  • We begin working on our STRETCH GOALS!

     

    WOO!!.

     

 

 

 

They will become available when we pass our goal of $10,000!.

 

If we raise an extra $1,000, we will create a book swap shelf, full of quality books to be shared with other people on a "give a book, take a book" basis.  You can bring in your old, gently used knowledge, and pass it on to others in the community.  Pretty cool.

 

 

If we raise an extra $2,000, we will create a library of board games to be rented out for only $1 an hour.  This will help create an even safer space in which to hang out when you aren't taking class, and bring together people of all ages.

 

 

If we raise an extra $3,000, we will have a weekly family film night on Saturdays, where we will show quality, family friendly movies.  This event will be absolutely free of charge, a service and thank you to the community.  For this, we need a projector and a means of connecting to the internet.

 

Everyone loves a good, rigorous yoga class, and doing yoga to techno or dubstep is a BLAST.  Enjoy this phenomenon even more with an actual, real, live DJ!  There will be one if we raise an extra $4,000

 

 

 

More Stretch goals will appear as earlier ones are unlocked!

 

 

 

  • If we don't make it, we will keep attempting to find more funding through grants and loans.  In the event that we are utterly unable to get enough money, we will explore renting space in other studios for a few hours each weekend.

  • However, rent in most studio spaces in Brooklyn costs at least $35 an hour.  Rent in a storefront for a day could cost us about $100.  For the entire day.  We are really hoping that works out.

  • This space will be an amazing asset to a beautiful, blossoming community.  It's good for everyone if this happens.

 

 

TELL PEOPLE.  LET THEM KNOW.

  • But no, seriously.  

  • Get the word out.  

  • Share the link.  

  • Share it with everyone you have ever met.

  • Send it to their grandmas.

  • And their sisters.

  • And their second cousins once removed.

 

If people don't know we exist, they can't help fund us.  If you want this to happen, please, share!

 

 

 

Glad you asked. 

Check out our Pinterest board to see our design concepts.

 

 

 

 

  • This would be an amazing addition to Brooklyn, Ditmas Park in particular.

  • It's something you can be proud to be involved in being a part of.

  • Wellness is for everyone.  It's not a luxury item.  It shouldn't be expensive.

  • New Yorkers should talk to people more, and we can help you out with that.

  • Yoga is fun, we have an awesome idea, and you should fund us because you'll like what we deliver.
story_txt:
Spring Into Yoga brings donation-based community Yoga & Zumba to NYC (and the world, through our website).


We have classes for adults.  Classes for kids.  Classes for everyone together, regardless of economic situation, race, religion, gender, age, ability...
Yoga.  Zumba. Together.  Stretching.  Working out.  Relaxing.  Learning.  Having fun.  Goofy, wonderful, ecstatic fun.  Together.


We believe that yoga, fitness, and wellness should be inexpensive, easily accessible, fun, and done together.


We have been giving classes outside all summer long, and to be able to continue serving NYC, we need a space.  To continue serving others, we need to produce free web content.  To do these things, we need your help.


 


So... uh... yeah.  You are probably wondering who we are.  


Spring Into Yoga started with Spring Into Yoga Festival in May 2013, and then quickly exploded into the organization that exists today, giving multiple classes weekly in Prospect Park, Brooklyn, and Central Park, Manhattan.  




Spring Into Yoga is run by Emily Buck, with help from a group of other certified (and certifiably awesome) yoga teachers and business-types including the majestic Sterling Silverhorse (who also has the best name, maybe, ever).  


We are currently in the process of registering as a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization.


 
 

We are trying to get a storefront, 
so that we can continue to bring classes to the community, while also creating a safe space for people to hang out, relax, and meet new friends.  We are also trying to provide free, quality content on our website to bring yoga, zumba, fitness, and community to others who are not in NYC.
 
 

Finding community in New York City is hard.  
(Surprisingly hard)


Do a quick Google search- there are hundreds of articles talking (and complaining) about it.  What better way to meet your neighbors than to bond over a shared passion, goal, or sweaty towel?  I can't think of any.
Finding community elsewhere isn't a piece of cake either. Unless you are amazing at just walking up to people and talking, which most of us aren't.
 



New York City is full of millions of people, and despite this, can be so impersonal.  


The beauty of this place lies in the moments that the walls between strangers break down.  The moment two people smile at the subway performer.  The moment someone holds a door open for you.  The moment   you accidentally kick someone in the face in yoga class, and then they ask you out on a date as you hand them an ice pack...  


We need more connection to others, and we are so scared to do it out on the street, or on public transportation.  


When everyone is trying to get fit, relax, and enjoy a class, we have something in common.  That is the moment when conversation can start, and friendship can be born.


  
 
That is Why Spring Into Yoga Needs a Studio Location.  

 
 
 

 



We need approximately $10,000 to secure a storefront rental, remodel it to our standards, and pay the first two months of rent.  


Getting a small business loan as a brand new nonprofit in a mostly for-profit industry is a tough sell.


Instead, we want to turn to the community- the same community that we wish to open our classes to, in order to create this space.  A space that is for you!


Most of all, we need people who like our idea, and want to come take class, and use our space!  


In other words... we need you.  Come join our tribe.  We have free coffee (with every class!)



 
 



Well, most importantly, you get a great new community yoga studio, unlike any other in NYC!  


You get to experience taking yoga classes next to a kid.  Or your grandma. Yoga with people you wouldn't normally do yoga with.  A stretching of the mind.


You get a safe, community space in which to hang out and relax.


You get classes especially for women, men, children, seniors, and beginners, as well as our signature all ages & abilities style class.


You get dubstep yoga friday nights.


You get a free cup of coffee, tea, or water with every yoga class (yep, free caffeine!).


You get nifty yoga workshops.


You get a book swap shelf at the studio, where you can drop off your old books, and take new ones home, free of charge!  It's like give a penny, take a penny, but with books.


You get board game rentals!  $1 an hour for a game.  Hang out and play with a friend. (stretch goal)


You get community movie nights, mixers, parties, and soirees. (stretch goal)


You get this great schedule full of classes...


 

 
 
 
 
 

 
Well, you get the best of perks!
  



With a $5 donation you receive a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  You made it happen.  You go, Glen Coco.
 
 


With a $10 donation you receive a  a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  Because, well, you rock.   You're a class act.
 
 


With a $15 donation you receive a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you. Yoga matters, and so do you!
 
 


With a $25 donation you receive a free private lesson with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.
 
 


With a $30 donation you receive a Spring Into Yoga tote bag, a free private lesson with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  Use the bag to go on awesome adventures, then come back, take class, and tell us all about it!
 
 


With a $50 donation you receive a Spring Into Yoga mug of your choice, a free private lesson with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  Use the coffee mug to stay awake while making your way around town, going to all those nifty places you go, those cool things you have to do.  Then come back for a class and fill your mug full of tea or java to relax it all away.
 
 



With a $75 donation you receive a high quality premium Spring Into Yoga t-shirt in the size and style of your choice, a two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  You'll be the most stylin kid in town with your Spring Into Yoga gear.  So cool.  You are so cool.  I kind of want to be you.
 
 


With a $90 donation you receive a limited edition Spring Into Yoga mat by Gaiam in the color of your choice.  This mat will never be for retail sale again after this campaign. You also receive two free private lessons with Emily, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on Facebook, and a hug.  Take class in style, and relax with Buddha. 
 
 
 


With a $90 donation, you receive a premium Spring Into Yoga tee in the size and style of your choice, a Spring Into Yoga tote bag, two free lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  You'll be the most fantabulous person in NYC with all of your matching stuff.  That's some amazing brand loyalty right there.  We love you.  You rock our socks.
 
 
 



With a $100 donation, you receive a high quality Spring Into Yoga hoodie in the size and style of your choice, two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  Running around town, or just walking to the post office, everyone will see you (and want to be you).  Especially everyone else in yoga class with you.
 
 
 
 


With a $140 donation, you receive a high quality Spring Into Yoga hoodie in the size and style of your choice, a Spring Into Yoga tote bag, two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  Running around town, or just walking to the post office, everyone will see you (and want to be you).  Especially everyone else in yoga class with you.
 
 
 
 

With a $175 donation, you receive a pass for 3 monthes of classes at Spring Into Yoga, two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a 3 monthes, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  And it sounds like we might be seeing you a lot.  Just think of how your abs are going to look!  Is it hot in here? 
 
 
 


With a $200 donation, you will receive a limited edition Gaiam Spring Into Yoga mat in the color of your choice, a Spring Into Yoga hoodie in the size and style of your choice,  two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a 3 monthes, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  And it sounds like we might be seeing you a lot.
 
 
 

With a $250 donation, your name will be on our donor wall in our studio, two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for a month, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you!  Thanks for your generosity and being a neato yogi.  Karma will reward you generously.
 
 
 

With a $300 donation, you receive a pass for 6 monthes of classes at Spring Into Yoga, three free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for 6 monthes, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  We'll be seeing you often, for awhile.  You sexy beast, you.
 
 
 

With a $550 donation, you receive a pass for 12 monthes of classes at Spring Into Yoga, your name on the wall, three free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a card for free mat rentals for 12 monthes, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you.  You're our new best friend.
 
 
 

We are planning to have a book swap shelf, board game rentals, a lounge area, a coffee bar, a desk, a mat rental station, and yes, even a bathroom. Get one of those named after you! Plus, get a free year of class and mat rentals, your name will be on our donor wall in our studio, two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a mug, a tee, a hoodie, a bag, a mat, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you!
 
 
 

Do you want our class to be called Billy Bob Zumba? With a $5000 donation, that right is yours! Choose a class option and get it named after you. Plus, get a free year of class and mat rentals, your name will be on our donor wall in our studio, a mug, a tee, a hoodie, a bag, a mat, two free private lessons with Emily Buck, our manager and founder, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you!
 
 

 You just singlehandedly funded our campaign.  For that, Emily is going to give you private yoga lessons once a week for the entire year.  Plus, get a free year of class and mat rentals, your name will be on our donor wall in our studio, a mug, a tee, a hoodie, a bag, a mat, a Spring Into Yoga sticker, a personal shoutout on our Facebook page, and a hug next time we see you!
 
 

We will literally name Spring Into Yoga after you.  Your name. On our storefront.  On our logo.  On towels.  You know you want your name on towels. Become a local celebrity.  We will also throw every other physical reward at you.  And chocolate.  Lots of chocolate.  You're our hero. 
 
 
 
 
 



We do the happiest dance ever done by anyone ever.


We begin working on our STRETCH GOALS!
 

WOO!!.

 


 
 
 

They will become available when we pass our goal of $10,000!.
 



If we raise an extra $1,000, we will create a book swap shelf, full of quality books to be shared with other people on a "give a book, take a book" basis.  You can bring in your old, gently used knowledge, and pass it on to others in the community.  Pretty cool.
 
 


If we raise an extra $2,000, we will create a library of board games to be rented out for only $1 an hour.  This will help create an even safer space in which to hang out when you aren't taking class, and bring together people of all ages.
 
 


If we raise an extra $3,000, we will have a weekly family film night on Saturdays, where we will show quality, family friendly movies.  This event will be absolutely free of charge, a service and thank you to the community.  For this, we need a projector and a means of connecting to the internet.
 


Everyone loves a good, rigorous yoga class, and doing yoga to techno or dubstep is a BLAST.  Enjoy this phenomenon even more with an actual, real, live DJ!  There will be one if we raise an extra $4,000
 
 
 
More Stretch goals will appear as earlier ones are unlocked!
 
 
 



If we don't make it, we will keep attempting to find more funding through grants and loans.  In the event that we are utterly unable to get enough money, we will explore renting space in other studios for a few hours each weekend.


However, rent in most studio spaces in Brooklyn costs at least $35 an hour.  Rent in a storefront for a day could cost us about $100.  For the entire day.  We are really hoping that works out.

This space will be an amazing asset to a beautiful, blossoming community.  It's good for everyone if this happens.

 
 

TELL PEOPLE.  LET THEM KNOW.


But no, seriously.  


Get the word out.  


Share the link.  


Share it with everyone you have ever met.


Send it to their grandmas.


And their sisters.


And their second cousins once removed.


 
If people don't know we exist, they can't help fund us.  If you want this to happen, please, share!

 
 
 


Glad you asked. 
Check out our Pinterest board to see our design concepts.
 
 
 
 



This would be an amazing addition to Brooklyn, Ditmas Park in particular.


It's something you can be proud to be involved in being a part of.




Wellness is for everyone.  It's not a luxury item.  It shouldn't be expensive.


New Yorkers should talk to people more, and we can help you out with that.


Yoga is fun, we have an awesome idea, and you should fund us because you'll like what we deliver.

story:
Short Summary

Lions HealthFirst Foundation NV-USA is a project of the Las Vegas International Lions Club and approved by the Lions Clubs International organization.

Lions Clubs have been serving the vision impaired and blind people for over 90 years. Lions are global and based in 210 countries and geographical areas.

Since 2006 Lions have been provide free or low cost preventative health screenings for people over 50.  Our goal is to help reduce the rate of death or disability from preventable diseases such as stroke and heart disease, and early detection of cancer and other abnormalities in the liver, kidneys, thyroid gland, spleen, gallbladder and the abdominal aorta.

There screenings are non-invasive, use no needles and no radiation, making these tests completely safe.

What We Need & What You Get

We are based in Las Vegas Nevada. Our ultrasound equipment is hospital quality and not mobile. Many seniors are unable to visit our screening facility, Therefore, we need to have the ability to take the screening service in the field and bring it to those most in need.

  • We are offering all those who donate $100 or more, a free abdominal/vascular screening of their key arteries and vital organs for early detection of signs of stroke, heart disease or cancer.
  • A portable ultrasound machine costs $30,000. In the event we raise less than the required amount, the funds will be allocated toward education regarding the need for health screenings and for assistance in transporting the most needed to our facility in Las Vegas.

The Impact

Heart disease is still the leading killer, followed by cancer and stroke. These diseases are life-threatening to the victim, but also devastating to the immediate family and the community in which they live.

  • The cost of health care is staggering. We can help manage some of these costs. For example: A stroke victim may require 6 months to a year for recuperation and rehabilitation. During that time, that person is unable to work, earn a living, support his or her family and pay many of the related medical bills. This can run into a hundred thousand dollars or more. The cost of a massive heart attack or certain types of cancer are just as devastating.
  • We have successfully tested over 1,000 seniors in Clark County.
  • Every year Lions Clubs give out millions of free eyeglasses. We help fund the Lions Burn Center at the University Medical Hospital in Las Vegas

Risks & Challenges

The challenge we face is two fold: one is to get more people screened, the other is to help provide, or make available follow-up care in cases where we discover serious problems.

Other Ways You Can Help

For friends of Lions Clubs and our Foundation who can't contribute, you can help spread the word about the need for preventive health screenings.

story:
Hello! Welcome to our Project Halo campaign page.

We're a new start-up here in Toronto called koldtec and we plan to save the world, one headache at a time.

No one should have to suffer through the pain and discomfort of headaches or migraines. We knew we could find a sophisticated solution - certainly better than just an ice pack and a dish cloth. 

Fortunately, we know a thing or two about engineered ice and wearable cooling gear, so we decided to take cold therapy to the next level and challenged ourselves to build an escape pod for your head.

We asked our team, "if cold therapy is one of the most trusted, natural and effective means of managing headache pain - then how can we leverage design and technology to go from good to better to best?"

We know we can't stop a headache or migraine from happening, or magically make it go away, but wouldn't it be great to have a better tool to deliver advanced cold therapy and help ease the discomfort?

We reached out to our instagram community with a crowd-design request for a wish list - and this advanced cold therapy project - Project Halo - started to take shape.

We set out to create the koldtec Halo with these main objectives in mind:

  • wearable and hands-free
  • targeted cold therapy, so the cold is delivered only where you need it most
  • adjustable fit for loose and comfy or snug and secure
  • flexible ice that can bend and contour to the natural shape of your head
  • "sleep-able" meaning you could fall asleep with it on 
  • block out light and minimize sound
  • sustainable fabrics and eco-friendly materials where ever possible
  • locally made in Toronto

We're happy to say....drumroll please...we did it!                                                                                         

Our team combined all of these wonderful design and functionality features and brought the koldtec Halo to life.  The escape pod for your head has been prototyped and tested; now it's all set and ready to go. We just need your support and financial commitment to flip the switch and begin production.

What makes the koldtec Halo so gosh darn great?

Perfect Fit

We've designed the koldtec Halo with an adjustable fit, so you can wear it loose and comfy or snug and secure.  We know that some folks like pressure and support - while others want a light and gentle touch.  We've allowed for ample space as you ultimately select how much ice to load and where; for a custom fit that's personally tailored to you. 

Wearable Cooling Gear

Say goodbye to holding an ice pack against your neck or a wet facecloth on your forehead. True Wearable Cooling Gear aka the koldtec Halo, gives you the freedom of mobility without having to compromise with ice that slides around, slips off, falls off or otherwise doesn't stay in contact with your body. Our internal ice pockets keep your cold locked-in and secure. The secret: we've sourced a low profile hook 'n loop that's molded, not woven - making it about 50% softer and thinner than traditional Velcro. 

Advanced Cold Therapy

We've researched the key headache spots and specifically isolated "pain point" zones where headaches are most common. Then we designed 2 internal ice pockets that you can load with FlexIce strips as needed to target each different zone. So, whether your headache origin is migraine, tension, cluster or sinus - we've got ice therapy in the places you need it most. The koldtec Halo allows you to select the ice placement to fit your personal zones, providing the best combination of advanced cold therapy.  Up to 9 ounces of ice at once!

Engineered FlexIce

Our patented, engineered FlexIce delivers an instant and long lasting chill to the targeted spots you need it most. Each FlexIce strip will stay cold for 45-60 minutes and it's designed to bend and contour to the shape of your head. Even better, your FlexIce strips come un-hydrated, so you hydrate and freeze the very first time to determine how thick or how thin (how hard or how soft essentially) you would like your ice to be. Best part: our FlexIce turns to gel - not water - when melting, so it actually gets more comfortable the longer you wear it!

Sleep Approved

We know, sometimes the best way to chase your headache away is to sleep it off.  So, we've made sure your koldtec Halo is soft & secure enough to wear to bed. The ice pockets are strategically placed to allow for various flat spots (where there's no ice) to comfortably allow you to rest your head and drift away into dreamland. The slim and lightweight "headband" design means no bulky hats or caps to wear. Plus, we've designed an optional, built-in sleep mask - just slide down the extra bamboo fabric - to make it night time, anytime.

Sensory "Underload"

We're quite sure you've heard of sensory overload - well, this is the opposite. Life is hectic enough with lights flashing and noises buzzing nonstop it seems.  We've designed the koldtec Halo with a pull-down, sleep mask to block out light - and 3 layers of super soft, bamboo fabric around your ears to minimize sounds. We said it's like an escape pod for your head and we weren't kidding around. 

Sustainable Bamboo

We've selected a naturally sustainable bamboo fabric for a super soft and comfy touch. This wonderful fabric is cool and breathable and wicks away moisture from the body, leaving you feeling dry and fresh. Our bamboo is also "scent neutral" and naturally antimicrobial, so say goodbye to chemical smells and odour! When it comes time to clean - don't worry - just toss it into the washing machine on a gentle cycle and air dry flat.  We wanted to make sure to pick a premium fabric that was extra easy for you to care for!

Insulated Travel Tube

Our travel tube is more than just cute and compact. It's actually a 3 piece, double-wall chamber capable of keeping your frozen FlexIce strips cold for up to 3 hours. Our travel tube is eco-friendly and made from 100% recycled paper. So, just freeze and go if you want to take your koldtec Halo for a road trip! Fits up to 9 ounces of ice.

Made Locally

We’ve made a commitment to local manufacturing right here in Toronto, Canada.  You can count on excellent quality from small-batch production and attention to detail. We promise to deliver our premium koldtec Halo to the global marketplace while proudly supporting our community at the same time.
