The koldtec Halo allows you to select the ice placement to fit your personal zones, providing the best combination of advanced cold therapy.  Up to 9 ounces of ice at once!Engineered FlexIceOur patented, engineered FlexIce delivers an instant and long lasting chill to the targeted spots you need it most. Each FlexIce strip will stay cold for 45-60 minutes and it's designed to bend and contour to the shape of your head. Even better, your FlexIce strips come un-hydrated, so you hydrate and freeze the very first time to determine how thick or how thin (how hard or how soft essentially) you would like your ice to be. Best part: our FlexIce turns to gel - not water - when melting, so it actually gets more comfortable the longer you wear it!Sleep ApprovedWe know, sometimes the best way to chase your headache away is to sleep it off.  So, we've made sure your koldtec Halo is soft & secure enough to wear to bed. The ice pockets are strategically placed to allow for various flat spots (where there's no ice) to comfortably allow you to rest your head and drift away into dreamland. The slim and lightweight "headband" design means no bulky hats or caps to wear. Plus, we've designed an optional, built-in sleep mask - just slide down the extra bamboo fabric - to make it night time, anytime.Sensory "Underload"We're quite sure you've heard of sensory overload - well, this is the opposite. Life is hectic enough with lights flashing and noises buzzing nonstop it seems.  We've designed the koldtec Halo with a pull-down, sleep mask to block out light - and 3 layers of super soft, bamboo fabric around your ears to minimize sounds. We said it's like an escape pod for your head and we weren't kidding around. Sustainable BambooWe've selected a naturally sustainable bamboo fabric for a super soft and comfy touch. This wonderful fabric is cool and breathable and wicks away moisture from the body, leaving you feeling dry and fresh. Our bamboo is also "scent neutral" and naturally antimicrobial, so say goodbye to chemical smells and odour! When it comes time to clean - don't worry - just toss it into the washing machine on a gentle cycle and air dry flat.  We wanted to make sure to pick a premium fabric that was extra easy for you to care for!Insulated Travel TubeOur travel tube is more than just cute and compact. It's actually a 3 piece, double-wall chamber capable of keeping your frozen FlexIce strips cold for up to 3 hours. Our travel tube is eco-friendly and made from 100% recycled paper. So, just freeze and go if you want to take your koldtec Halo for a road trip! Fits up to 9 ounces of ice.Made LocallyWe’ve made a commitment to local manufacturing right here in Toronto, Canada.  You can count on excellent quality from small-batch production and attention to detail. We promise to deliver our premium koldtec Halo to the global marketplace while proudly supporting our community at the same time.

story:
We are raising money to help Fred and Kayn rebuild their lives. The main lodge at Pine Falls, which was lost in a fire was their home. . Any and all donations are welcomed and greatly appreciated in this difficult time.

Kaynan is a 15 year old boy in grade 10. He is a big fan of X-box, carpentry, car mechanics and an avid fisherman. On weekends he helped his dad out around the lodge busing tables, cleaning cabins, and being an awesome host. When not helping out he was usually hanging out with friends enjoying the property.

Fred is the adventurous entrepreneur who took over the lodge in 2010. Having never experienced life in the middle of the great north he dove right in and was known as being a welcoming host and a tireless owner.

On March 5th, 2015, a fire broke out in the furnace room of the main lodge. Fred and Kayn tried their hardest to stop the spread but were unsuccessful. The two were able to get their animals out, Diesel the great Dane and Frenchy and Dougie the cats and suffered from only minor burns on their face.

The lodge was their family home, and was home to the rest of the members of the Dunham family throughout their years there. Their lives were in that lodge: photo albums, clothes, winter jackets, boots, furniture, their trinkets and treasures.

Any donation of any value would help and go towards basic toiletries, clothing, winter jackets, boots, gloves, school supplies for Kaynan, etc and helping them start to rebuild their lives from nothing. We greatly appreciate the warm thoughts and well wishes from the community and want to extend a thank you to anyone who is able to help out in anyway!

story:
• ONLY non-profit organization that provides funding to ALL certified health clinics nationwide
  • Helps women gain access to safe, legal abortion services and emergency contraceptives

Donate to WRRAP to Keep Safe, Legal Abortion Accesible to All

  • Depends on funding from private donations. 
  • All volunteer model
  • 90% of donations directly benefits women
  • Under unprecedented attack by anti-choice groups and legislators

About WRRAP

Founded in 1991, WRRAP assists women of all ages, ethnicities and cultural backgrounds who are financially unable to pay for safe, legal abortions or emergency contraceptives.


How We Work

We provide funds to pre-screened, pre-qualified health clinics across the nation on behalf of poor and disadvantaged women in need of abortion services or emergency contraceptives , on a case-by-case basis. Our affiliate clinics are members of Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) and National Abortion Federation (NAF), and both feature the latest, state-of-the-art facilities, and best practices and procedures.


We’re Here to Help, Not Judge!

90% Directly Benefits Women 

Our mission 

  • To ensure women from all walks of live have access to safe, legal abortion
  • Does not demand repayment of funds
  • Does not judge

Check out The WRReal World blog to learn more about WRRAP and read the stories about the real women WRRAP helps every day.

Your donation is tax deductible

WRRAP's funding comes from private sources through our own fundraising efforts. WRRAP depends on funding from private foundations and individuals like you to continue its important work.  Your donation is tax deductible up to the maximum amount permitted by law. 

Donate to WRRAP Today and Thank You.

story:
Additional informations about Lite Edition :

  • Smartphone accepting a 64Gb microSD card or an USB key (USB OTG port) required
  • Screen resolution of at least 1920x1080 is recommended for a good image quality
  • Bluetooth LE or ANT+ connectivity required 
  • 6 premium quality tracks will be provided on a high capacity MicroSD or USB key (depending on the compatibility of your smartphone). 
  • Including a Wireless cadence sensor (ANT+/BLE)
  • Compatible with external ANT+/Bluetooth heart rate chest belt (not included)
  • Compatible with "smart" turbo trainers, steering control on FE-C implementing ones
  • Is your smartphone compatible ? Download our App Perform VR Player on the Google Play Store to know if your smartphone is compatible. 

 - List of recommended smartphones accepting a microSD card

- List of recommended smartphones accepting an USB key (USB OTG port)

 

 

 

 

Stay connected & Share it

We would love to keep you updated with our latest news. And don't keep it secret ! Share our vision of the future of fitness to your friends & family ! They will adore it.

 

 

Frequently Asked Questions: 

Are Fit Immersion kits made for me?

Whether you are a gym owner, an athlete or a sport & tech enthusiast, Fit Immersion kits are made for you. From the Pro Edition designed for gym to the Lite Edition created for owners of a high-end smartphone, there is an edition for everyone.

 

I’m looking for motivation, will Fit Immersion headsets help me to work out regularly?

Fit Immersion solution is specially designed to bring fun and interest in working out at home or at the gym. The wide range of breathtaking tracks and trainings also allows you to vary your sessions. Finally, the deep monitoring and analysis provided by Fit Immersion kits will boost up your motivation to train regularly.

 

Which kind of tracks Fit Immersion kits come with?

Fit Immersion kits come with natural real filmed and captured from 3D tracks in 360°. New tracks will regularly be proposed.

 

How Fit Immersion kits are better than classical exercise machines with a screen?

Fit Immersion kits provide a more immersive experience than classical exercise machines, through breathtaking 360° tracks and head up display performance monitoring. Unlike classical exercise machines, Fit Immersion kits are wireless, allowing hands free control during the exercise to focus on the training. Widely compatible, Fit Immersion kits can be used with a large range of exercise machines. Last but not least, new tracks will be proposed regularly to maintain interest of you or your customers.

 

How Fit Immersion kits are so light?

The kits are made of quality plastic, for both its durability and lightweight. Lightweight is essential for us, to provide the most comfort during your workout.

 

How long is the battery life of Pro and Premium Edition? How do I charge it?

The battery life is estimated at 2H. It will allow various user to train, or long training of a single user.

These kits are easy to charge, just plug the USB cable to the headset and to the charging block.

It is also possible to let the charge cable connected during use. In this case the battery discharge is very slow and the headset can be use all the day long.

 

Will the headset not move during the training?

Specially designed for sport, all kits are coming with a unique sport strap. Similar to those on bike helmets, the sport strap ensures a perfect and comfortable maintain during the training.

 

With which exercise machines are these kits compatible?

These kits are compatible with recumbent exercise bikes, spin bikes, exercise bikes, elliptical bikes and Smart Turbo trainers. Automatic steering control is implemented by using ANT+ FE-C protocol.

FE-C implementing turbo trainers list 

 

Are these kits simple to install?

Yes, these kits are simple to install. Wireless, you just have to install the speed sensor on the pedal and turn on the headset.

When will Fit Immersion iOS app be available?

We want to launch the iOS app before the end of 2018. 

 

What OS do Fit Immersion kits use?

Fit Immersion kits use Nibiru OS. It’s an Android based OS designed especifically for VR headsets to provide stable and efficient use.

 

Do Fit Immersion kits need a cellular connection?

No, Premium kits use Bluetooth, WIFI and ANT+ connections. ANT+ stick is only provided for Turbo trainer version.

 

 

Do you offer global shipping?

We do offer global shipping.  

 

Other questions?

If you have any questions, please contact us: contact@fitimmersion.com

story:
Airsoft is a sport that is quickly gaining momentum in the United States and has already had huge success in Europe and Asia.  However, the very nature of the sport if done irresponsibly, can draw very negative critisim and sometimes even legal action.  The bottom line is, air soft is a sport played with 1:1 weapons replicas and the participants have a tendency to wear “tactical gear” and military style clothing.  Obviously, one can see why this should not be played in the “woods” behind a residential neighborhood or in site of the public for that manner.

 

The MACC, MAKO Advanced Combat Center, is a safe, controlled, insured facility where a responsible, well organized staff, The MAKO Team, can host the sport of air soft on a legitimate, decommissioned military base.  What makes The MACC stand out head and shoulders above other places in the Midwest are the attention to detail we bring to our vision and the unique history of the property.  

 

The MACC sits on an actual NIKE missile base from the late 50’s- early 60’s era of the cold war.  That alone makes it appealing to the young teen just getting into the sport to the veteran player that is looking for a challenge for themselves or team.  Also, since The MACC sits on 21 acres of rural property it makes it the perfect place for not only air soft, but also police training and exercises with no risk of the afore mentioned “hazards” sometimes associated with this sport.  

 

Hands down, The MACC is a huge asset to this sport because it is the only privately owned urban facility in the Midwest; bringing to fruition concepts that the competition is only talking about.  It is clean, it is safe and it is fully insured.  It is also very expensive to run and make the improvements that will keep us dominating the industry well into the future.  This is why, The MAKO Team, is looking for outside investors for the first time.

story:
日本語をご希望の方：

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1rKgpUUJQ88n...

中文讀者請點這: 

https://docs.google.com/document/d/13PNmFiAksIT...

ប្រសិនបើអ្នកចង់អានជាភាសាខ្មែរ

https://docs.google.com/document/d/163umvLbPH-_AAkI_t-m6-uEAeB3GTyqGZrQ5iRNOlRg/edit

 

Who We Are 

Graphis Health Center (GHC) provides critical health care to Cambodians living in rural areas with limited access to proper medical care due to poverty and remote locales.  Located in Prey Proseth Village, 120 km west of Phnom Penh, GHC is surrounded by 100 acres of forest and mountains—or what we like to call the Land.  Due to its location in middle of the jungle and near a major road, GHC has responded to and treated thousands of emergency and trauma patients since being founded in 2010 by Dr. Peter Li.  GHC is dedicated to providing the highest quality of care regardless of the financial or social status of our patients. 

In an emergency, every second counts.  With the nearest hospital 80km away-for many, GHC is their only chance of survival. Patients who have suffered from accidents or trauma can be admitted as short or long-term in-patients to receive professional and compassionate palliative and rehabilitative care. All GHC medical staff are on call 24/7-and even at night, at least one staff is awake to check on our patient while the others take turns sleeping inside the health center.  

70% of GHC patients are out-patients.  In remote provinces, many villagers have never been treated by medical personnel and most have limited knowledge of basic health and hygiene practices. GHC provides health education, consultation, and treatment to local villagers from the surrounding rural provinces.  Some even travel hundreds of kilometers for our medical services. Many of our patients are children who come to us with severe infection, malaria, or dengue fever.  All of these are curable but without the proper diagnoses and treatments- they are fatal. 

Although GHC is in the Cambodian jungle, we have the training, equipment, resourcefulness, and compassion to treat our patients at the highest standard. Our motto is simple-- we do the things we do so that others may live. 

A Profile of Our Sai

In August 2011, GHC and Taiwanese medical volunteers from Chuang Gung Memorial Hospital responded to an emergency 90 km away from Phnom Penh.  When they arrived at the scene, the nearby villagers had already pulled the victims to the side of the road.  All the victims were only slightly injured except for one—Sai, a 26 year-old woman. 

When the villagers pulled Sai from the car, it further exacerbated her injuries. GHC took Sai to a national hospital where she was diagnosed with a C5-C6 spinal injury – permanently paralyzing her from the neck down.

After one week, Sai was transferred to GHC for rehabilitation.  She stayed at GHC for a few days before her family requested us to take her home to be treated by a traditional healer.  One week later, Sai returned to GHC with severe infections and bedsores so deep you could see her tailbone.

When the family asked for GHC’s help, we admitted Sai as an in-patient.  Everyday, the GHC staff gave her antibiotics for her infection and spread iodine and sugar paste for her bedsores.  It wasn’t until weeks later that we discovered that Sai was pregnant!  GHC staff worked diligently to keep her and the baby alive.

On May 3rd 2012, Pich was born--a beautiful, healthy baby girl.  Sai and Pich are still with us at GHC today.  Sadly the family has not been in contact or shown her any support since the birth, but GHC staff continues to support Sai and her child with medical care, shelter, food, and clothing.

Why We Need Your Support

The sad truth is that many of our patients are like Sai who come to us as their last resort.  Many have spent their life savings at private clinics in hopes of a cure but in the end are left with a mountain of debt and the effects of harmful treatments, which cause even more damage to their health.  Others are so sick/injured that they are a financial and emotional burden on their family, and as a result no one will take care of them.

This is why GHC started the Poor Patient Fund.  For those patients who cannot pay, we waive our $1.25 consultation fee and give them medicine and treatment for free. We aim to treat our patients until they are fully recovered so that they are not at-risk of developing more severe health issues in the future. However, the costs of continual check-ups and treatments add up very quickly.  

This is why GHC needs your support. For poor in-patients like Sai, we spend $400/month just on medical supplies.  We need at least $10,000 to effectively treat our poor patients for the next year. Every penny you donate will go directly to helping treat our patients who cannot afford any treatments or medications.

Others Way You Can Help

We would appreciate any help you can give.  Even if you are not in a financial position to donate, you can still spread the word to your friends and family and through social networking websites like Facebook.  If you are interested in visiting GHC, donating medical supplies, or volunteering your services please email us at info@cdepcambodia.org.

If you have any technical issues or have any questions concerning this fundraising campaign please email us at cdep.ghc.fundraising@gmail.com.

story:
My name is Lorene Penick.  My niece Pam had a liver transplant one year ago due to a genetic disease.  She has had a long and agonizing journey and it's not over yet.  Her family has been burdened with the high cost of prescriptions and medical bills.  Even with insurance the cost is astronomical.

Pam and her husband, Barry, have two children and one grandson.  Their daughter Nicole, a teacher, lives in Florida with her husband Justin and her nine month old son, Jayden.  Their son, Ian graduated last year.  They have been residents of Kendallville, IN all of their lives.


If you can't afford to give we understand.  You can help by sharing this with others.  Any help will be appreciated.

God blessed our family by letting Pam live.  The world is a better place with her in it.

Thank You
story_txt:
My name is Lorene Penick.  My niece Pam had a liver transplant one year ago due to a genetic disease.  She has had a long and agonizing journey and it's not over yet.  Her family has been burdened with the high cost of prescriptions and medical bills.  Even with insurance the cost is astronomical.
Pam and her husband, Barry, have two children and one grandson.  Their daughter Nicole, a teacher, lives in Florida with her husband Justin and her nine month old son, Jayden.  Their son, Ian graduated last year.  They have been residents of Kendallville, IN all of their lives.
If you can't afford to give we understand.  You can help by sharing this with others.  Any help will be appreciated.
God blessed our family by letting Pam live.  The world is a better place with her in it.
Thank You

story:
Let's get one thing straight.  The Zombie Apocalypse isn't an 'if', it's a 'when'.  Got that?

So, we want to help as many people as possible NOT become zombies.  That's a total no-brainer.  Umm... you know what we mean.

Z-Ban is a new Alcohol-Free Hand, Skin & Wound Sanitizer that has been tested against just about every virus, bacteria and spore known to man, and we want to make sure YOU have some before the zombies start showing up around your neighborhood.  The challenge is that we need to get a production run going, and that's where YOU can help!

If you help us fund, we'll repay your mongo generosity with your own supply of Z-Ban!  Talk about a win/win situation!  You help us, we help you, humans win, zombies lose!

Donation levels start at just SEVEN BUCKS!  If we can get the first 500 bottles sold, we can get the materials made, the bottles purchased, and the incredible Z-Ban Skin and Wound Sanitizer OUT TO YOU!  One bottle can treat up to ten bites!  (We're pretty sure about that.  It's been hard to find people willing to volunteer to get bitten by a zombie.)

Help us help you!  Let's beat this zombie virus once and for all!

  • Tell EVERYONE YOU KNOW!  The fewer zombies the better!

  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

  • We have enough prototypes in stock to fulfill ANY orders that might come in early!

  • We begin shipping within DAYS of your donation!  PROMISE!

 

And remember, the Apocalypse is probably going to start in LESS THAN TWO WEEKS, on 12/21/2012 (we double checked the Mayan calendar and yup!  There it is! "Apocalypse Starts NOW!)

story:
THERE'S A PROBLEM WE CAN HELP SOLVE IN LUSAKA

We have the technology to create water infrastructures at a sophisticated level, worldwide. And, in Zambia, there is water in the ground already. And yet the people of Lusaka have little access to clean water. We can help by pitching in to fund a clean water unit.

  We have sophisticated water treatment and waste management systems and they are relatively inexpensive to create and install. So that's what we aim to do for the people of Chaisa Compound in Lusaka, Zambia.

  Here on IndieGoGo, anyone can help: Jet setter, diplomat, concerned citizens and students alike.   Sister Cities of Los Angeles is pleased to support the LA-Lusaka Sister City Committee's effort to create water access in our sister city Lusaka, Zambia.

This project is led by the Los Angeles-Lusaka Sister City Committee; Dr. Ernestine Robertson (President, LA-LSCC), and Project Director Ms. Lidia Mongerie Brown.

THE CONTEXT  

After the implementation of a successful Micro-Finance Project in nine contiguous areas of Lusaka, Zambia, the Los Angeles-Lusaka Sister City Committee's Women's Entrepreneur Program has embarked upon a desperately needed Clean Water Project at Chaisa Compound in the region of Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia.

  The Los Angeles-Lusaka Sister City Committee is the first and only African Sister City to the City of Los Angeles, founded in 1968, Strong relations were solidified by the late Mayor Tom Bradley and the founding President of Zambia, Dr. Kenneth Kaunda.  

The president of the Los Angeles-Lusaka Sister City Committee is Dr. Ernestine Robertson, and the Project Director is Ms. Lidia Mongerie Brown.

WHO ARE WE AND WHY ARE WE HERE?  

The objective of this campaign is to raise funds for a Clean Water Project which integrates the provision of clean water with other environmental considerations such as water and waste treatment measures, disease reduction (malaria and diarrhea are both tied to morbidity rates and the need for "better management of water resources reduces transmission of malaria and other vector-borne diseases"), and irrigation systems that are less than sufficient. 

This endeavor would set the stage for sustainable development in Lusaka and surrounding communities where there are intensified pockets of under-development, specifically related to clean water.  

The citizens will be the primary stakeholders. The experts engaged to install the Clean Water Unit will have a working knowledge of water and waste systems, treatment processes and mechanical know how regarding septic and sewage and how they impact health and the environment.  

THE CAMPAIGN GOAL  : A TRICKLE DOWN EFFECT

The funds raised in this campaign will allow the LA-Lusaka Sister City Committee to purchase initial hardware, software, supplies and human resources to develop a small scale clean water infrastructure. This will make a significant difference in the quality of life for Zambians in Chaisa Compound and communities in and surrounding Lusaka.

The goal - simply put - is to provide access to clean water by building a clean water unit. This unit will not only help the citizens of Lusaka gain access to clean water, it will eventually also help improve waste water treatment, irrigation and recycling, sanitation and hygiene facilities and practices. 

In time, this will provide better use of energy, maintenance of a green environment, and creation of jobs. Each measure, in its own right, will contibute to a sustainabie approach to water management.

THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

Louie Wear (Louie Loves) is a charitable, customizable and wearable personal brand. It promotes individual “likes” such as charitible causes, sports, hobbies and downright good stuff. Louie Wear is all about positivity, optimism and love.  Check out our photo gallery for other images as well!  Louie can, and will, love everything and this is just the start!

Louie is you. Louie is me. Louie is we.

What We Need & What You Get

Any and all donations are truly appreciated and donations of $25 or more get you a Louie Loves Boobies Tee Shirt!!  And it'll make you feel good for such great causes.  If you do select the shirt option, you'll provide your email address so we can follow up with sizing and all that good stuff, so don't fret.

We need $1,000 to print and create our first brand of tee shirts, proceeds of which will be donated to both the North Shore Animal League and the Breast Cancer Network of WNY.  The first batch of tees for Louie Loves will be sold at the Beer Bacon Boobs event on September 8th, 2012 (http://beerbaconboobs.com/)

This is our first cause of action and with the funding, it will ensure that it won't be the last.  Other causes are on the horizon, such as our raising money for veterans with our Louie Loves the Troops logo (to be made available soon!).  This fundraising will give Louie Loves the needed spark to launch and succeed!

The Impact

By donating to this cause, you will personally help with paying for the tee shirts, marketing and distribution for which proceeds are donated as mentioned above.  Not to mention, increasing the awareness for this awesome event and cause of action!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate to this round, that's cool, sharing this link is greatly appreciated too (wink wink).  You can also show up to the event on September 8th and be ready to pitch in for a great cause.  If you can't donate but want to stay connected with our upcoming causes, please email us at louieloveseverything@gmail.com, and thanks!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Five women from Yoga Freedom Project are headed to Cambodia in October to educate ourselves, connect with trafficking survivors, meet with organizations (including Somaly Mam's Cambodian Afesip) who rescue and serve survivors, and bring supplies and necessities to survivors. We are working to end sex trafficking in our world.

To make this trip a reality we need $3k more and we are asking you to support us!

Early this year in January 2012, Yoga Freedom Project raised 25k for The Somaly Mam Foundation through a campaign with the global yoga community. We plan to do the same this year and raise even more in January 2013! Until then, we are doing the hard work of becoming our own non profit organzation and setting ourselves up officially so we can best serve the population we are passionate about helping. We are also committed to providing yoga for trafficking and trauma survivors and we are currently teaching the girls at Gems in NYC. We are passionate about what we do and know this experience in Cambodia will make our future work even more effective.

 

Thank you all for your support!

 

Also if you cannot give finanancially, we are also bring over yoga mats and sneakers if you would like to support these girls with a donation. Email me at snyder.heather@gmail.com to contribute.

 

 With gratitude, The YFP team traveling to Cambodia

Heather Snyder, Danielle O'Connell, Venetia Boucher, Sandra Sirota, Meaghan Jarensky

story:
Hello all!

As first suggested on Facebook, in support of Dave Sharp from Safe Cycling Australia, I'm seeking 50 willing contributors of $20.00 AU to raise total funds of $1000.00 AU for the purchase of a road bike to get Dave on the road and mobile again.

This campaign will run for 60 days.

I don't personally know Dave Sharp and at time of writing, nor have I met him.

My interest in this is to see him in a position where he can participate in the very activity that he actively campaings for here in Brisbane, Australia.

Safe Cycling Australia (http://www.safecyclingaustralia.org/ or http://www.facebook.com/SafeCyclingAustralia?ref=stream) is in my opinion, an easily digestible road safety message that ultimitely aides my safe return home to my family each and every time I go on the road.

I'm an enthusiast of spreading the word of Safe Cycling Australia for this very reason and I hope by wearing my Safe Cycling Australia jersey, little by little drivers will take notice, have adhoc discussion as they recall seeing it and perhaps ultimitely influence the condition of driver habbit, behaviour and tolerance - and in turn keep a few more Mums, Dads and Kids alive on our roads.

Like many people before Dave who have started their own ventures, they've had to make financial sacrifices to 'keep the boat afloat' of the venture they believe in.

My expectation is that perhaps Dave has made similar sacrifices, thus leaving him bikeless and unable to participate in the very activity he campaigns for, which to me - seems unreasonable.

What I don't think is unreasonable is to seek $20.00 contributions from willing participants to achieve this goal of $1000.00 

Hopefully you will agree same and my sincere thanks in anticipation of your consideration to getting Dave Sharp mobile again.

You too can spread the word of Safe Cycling Australia with your own bike apparel. Please visit http://www.scody.com.au/event-merchandise/event_215/

story:
Stuff Happening so Fast!

The title says it all, I'm having a hysterectomy on Wednesday, August the 28th (it was previously the 14th, but was postponed a second time) and because my job is so physical I won't be able to return to work for a whole 6 weeks.

I scheduled my surgery a month ago, and normally I would credit my late recovery fund on the fact that I do nothing better than procrastinate, but since LSU Hospital was in the process of being bought out by Childrens Hospital and Touro we weren't 100% sure the date was going to stay the same until recently. 

If you're wondering why a man would need a hysterectomy, please look up FTM hysterectomy. 

Slow Summer = Slow Money

Summers are slow in NOLA and since I haven't been working as much as I normally do the rest of the year I'll need your help to be able to survive the next month and a half. I think you deserve to know exactly what I'm doing with the money you're donating to keep me going until I get back to work.

Here is how things in my life go:

Rent $300

Bills $100

Insurance $50

Food $200

Frida's food & flea meds $50

 My Monthly Medications $100


If you donate using Paypal, funds go to Elizabeth's account because mine is broken. 

Now that we're done having the awkward money conversation let us take a look at what you get in return for helping me out!

 

I have a lot of amazing talented friends who have been so kind to help me with gifts to offer y'all. Elizabeth and Kiernan have spent a lot of time screen printing some sweet posters and post cards, Casey has donated some of her handmade jewelry, and Emily has jars of lovely scented bath salts.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate money, you can donate your time! You can:

  • Give me rides to doctors' appointments (I won't be able to drive myself for two weeks)
  • Take Frida on a walk
  • Bring us a meal
  • Let me do laundry at your house instead of a laundromat
  • Keep me company
  • Write me a letter

Email us at mrmeowtheunicorn@gmail.com for more information.

Every little bit helps!
